text: If i could rate this place 6 out of 5 stars, I would! The food was amazing, and full of flavor! I enjoyed the brown rice bowl, and I never knew rice could have so much flavor! It was amazing to see how the chefs could find new and bright favors to add to their food. The green goddess salad was also delicious, and it was probably one of the best salads that I have ever had! My son, who is 15, also enjoyed the food, which is great because I can never get him to eat healthy foods, so I have found the place which I can get him to eat better! The vibe of the entire restaurant was so fun and happy, and expertly designed! It was one of the coolest restaurants I have ever been to! I will be returning to Panacea very soon, and I am so excited to see the new things they add to the menu!

This place was very quaint and clean.  I really liked the vibe there.  I ordered a Love Burger.  The first time I ate there, it was amazingly delicious.  The second time I went in there, I ordered the same burger and it was cold and soggy. An eleven dollar burger should not be cold and soggy.   Might go back but not on a regular basis.
Love it here!!!! Everything was wonderful. Best smoothies in town. Love the concept of dining sans alcohol in this city, very refreshing!!
Vegan everything. So good. The house made ranch is so yummy. Wish they had places like this in Sacramento.  Thanks guys!

What a great new Vegan place in Boca Park. I've been to a few vegan restaurants and this one by far stands out. The food is fresh and falvorful. And they have the best vegan burger in the world. Ok, I haven't been around the world eating vegan burgers but if I would have I'm pretty sure noone would even come close to the one here at Panacea. It's that good!!!! Come see for yourself. You won't be disappointed.

The food was outstanding. The presentation was beautiful everything was flavorful and fresh. The bar presented mock tales that were unbelievable, tasty, and also very well presented. The edamame had sliced roasted garlic and delicious flavor.  We are not regular vegan eaters and were very much surprised by how fantastic all the food was.  We intend to go back and would recommend it to anyone looking for a great meal.

Wow! One of the best burgers I've ever eaten - and it doesn't even have meat! I'm not a vegetarian and I really like this place. Seriously, the ultimate burger is super good!!! I also tried the freakeh bowl and it was great! Great atmosphere also. Oh! And the hostess cupcake was very good - they could have added more cream filling though.

Experience it yourself. I am no food critic, I don't have a blog in the N.Y. Times, I don't write for Food & Wine, I don't hang out with Bourdain or Robuchon. This is simply clean, delicious wholesome food. Simplicity is beautiful. 

For those of you saying this is an expensive place to eat, I say this.....Is your health not worth it, I rather pay for quality and taste now than overpay for health care later or sooner. 

Clean atmosphere. Go and experience yourself.

My main complaint for this restaurant is that they are hell a slow. Ordering is slow because they want to shoot the breeze with everyone, which is honestly inconsiderate to those waiting in line. They say it will be out in 15 min then 35 min later still waiting.

This is a great place to study! My favorite appetizer is the chili cheese fries- I just recently found out that the cheese is non-dairy. It's amazing and didn't taste like it. Great service and clean atmosphere.

I have been here 7-8 times in the past 6 months. I fell in love with the Ultimate Burger. It is one of the best burgers I've ever had and definitely the best vegan burger. I have also tried the umami spinach noodles and the Buffalo cauliflower. The food is always delicious. 

My gripe is that the kitchen seems to be inconsistent, because nothing ever tastes the same as the last time. When I first came, the ultimate burger was almost perfect except that the patty falls apart and it can get messy. I think this may have been brought to their attention because the next few times the party was coated in toasted quinoa, making it more nutty but a little more dry. Sometimes the cheese is melted, sometimes not so much. Sometimes too little condiments. 
They are also quite pricey but im a returning customer because the food tastes fresh, the flavors are great, and the atmosphere is beautiful.

Panacea's is a welcome addition to the Las Vegas restaurant scene. The menu is well planned and offers a variety of dishes, drinks and desserts.  Talking to the management, they  also support the total wellness aspect of "living" (in the future will host webinars re healthy living).  Prices are in line with the ingredients they are using.  I talked to the chef and am thrilled that they buy  many ingredients from organic farmers and suppliers from around the world.   My wife and I ordered the kale green salad and really recommend the rutabaga and  jerusalem artichoke dish. The double patty hamburger is excellent with a blend of many ingredients and no soy.  It is juicy, well done and truly tastes like a very good beef burger (not the usual soy patty served at other restaurants).  For dessert we shared a chocolate chip cookie and several matcha and pistachio balls. I predict that Panacea will become a destination restaurant for all of Las Vegas Valley. As  their reputation expands they will attract out of town guests.  My wife and I are from  San Francisco and very familiar with the healthy eating boutique restaurants. We can say that if Panacea opened in the Bay Area or Napa wine country it would be a "hit". We look forward to make Panacea a regular  part of our dining out experience.   GREG Y.
Great place for vegan friends, I am not vegan. But my friend is and she really enjoyed it.

Their veggie burger on potato bun is so soft and delicious. Their black/brown rice bowls and Goji Berry, Matcha, Lemon pistachio truffles are amazing. If you want to eat heathy but can't give up burgers and pastries, check out this restaurant!

I have been in your place 3 times, my second time was waiting for 2 hummus bowls took them 35 minutes, even the waiting was ridiculous was awesome, they kept saying is a new menu that they are trying, well I said to myself, I work in a kitchen as well I know, i just went back today, i order 3 items I order them at 1:21pm the girl that took my order said 20 minutes , understandable, I called was 1:49 they said 5 more minutes, they passed and I go to pick my order up, for my surprise my order never went through, even the food was good I don't know if I will be back, this time I was wondering myself what kind of cooks did you hired in your kitchen, shame on them , I know when you eat you are not supposed to eat fast , but your cooks they don't have sense of urgency which is important never the less the girl that took my order said that she left a note , nobody knew , they are lacking in communication, and the restaurant is not that big. Well besides this I wish you a very good grand opening, that is what the girl said, The Best Of Luck for your restaurant.

I am newly vegan and this place is amazing!!! I've been here two days in a row. I've had the gratitude smoothie, banana nut muffin, and hostess cupcake and loved all of them. I'm so happy there is a place like this in Vegas and hope they will be expanding their menu. It is going to make it very easy to continue a vegan lifestyle.
Seriously best vegan, non vegan place to eat. Their Osaka burger is the best burger I've ever had.

Me and my friend have came out of town for a visit and we wanted to try something different. We have ordered a slice of their (Vegan) Cheesecake and the waiter said it will take 10 minutes tops to receive our dish/dessert. We havent received our order til 30 minutes later. I feel very upset about my order and how the service was here. I feel like I was mistreated and I was not wanted inside the restaurant. Cheesecake was sort of.... Ehhhh felt weird after. Overall not happy about my experience in Panacea.
We stumbled into this gem while passing through. The food was beautiful and delicious.

I have been here several times now. This last time I went I got the forbidden rice bowl (which I have had previously). My black rice wasn't even cooked all the way. Was still hard. I couldn't even eat it. Problem was I took it as take out and by the time I got to my desk to eat lunch. I couldn't even eat it. Made me really mad considering I spend $15 and loved this dish previously.

Just took my first bite of the Ultimate Burger.... mmmmm..... darned good.

My smoothie, named Gratitude, is yummy.

Overheard the neighboring diners saying how everything they've tried here is good.

Can't wait to try the Asian burger that I heard is about to be introduced.

Sarah, at the counter, couldn't have been nicer.

If you want to try healthy food that also tastes great, then you should come here.
Just found this place three weeks ago and have been three times! Everything I've tried has been great.

Fantastic atmosphere and staff! I ordered the Nitrate cold brew coffee here. I had high expectations because the coffee was priced higher than other places. The coffee was better than all the other places I've been to and I came back.
This is probably my favorite place to come and chill. The food is amazing and the vibe is great! And it's a great place for any student who wants a place to study.

Food was tasty, no doubt. The decor is cool and interesting with large sliding door panels for the bathroom, Mason jar DIY feel decoration hanging by very rough looking rope. Lots of other "textural" things as well. I give it four stars, based on all of it, but had to deduct a star for a nonsensical/ poorly explained 'upgrade" policy. Apparently, you get a burger with a small salad for $15. I was asked for extras like cheese and fries, I said yes. Turns out, you now don't GET the salad...first time I have seen what is 'built' into the price point of a dish get removed from the offer table even though you are paying more for fries. And no, sorry the sweet potato fries were not Soooo amazing that they outweigh the value of the small salad. Nobody likes to feel Nickel and dimed when they dine! Server had the opportunity to fix the issue by giving the small salad but opted instead to enforce the policy. Good food, just not good value/communication of a statistically unusual pricing model.

I don't know how to feel about this place in all honesty. It's my first visit (possibly my only) so maybe my review will change in the future.

I came in here a few days ago but just remembered I wanted to write a review.

First off, this place is expensive. Like...pretty expensive. Paid $12.99 for a salad of just a handful of things.  I could have went to Whole Foods and gotten over a pound of a salad and  paid less. It was the 118 salad. The dressing was tasty but it was burning my lips and mouth to the point where I almost didn't want to eat it, but I did. It was good but not worth the money considering it was very skimpy. Says it comes with crispy quinoa and has literally just a few grains of it sprinkled over the top. I'm really upset because I really wanted to enjoy this place but I don't think I'll ever come back unless someone else is paying (lol)

The inside was cute, the customer service was eh. I could have went to Panera bread and gotten an entire meal for the price and would have been filled up. I ate this salad and was still hungry, and I don't usually eat much.

I really wished I liked this place and if you wanna try it by all means go! But keep in mind that you will be paying a lot if you want to be satisfied/full.

Finally! A great place for vegan and plant based food. My husband and I went the first day they were open. I got the edamame and it was delicious. It had a really good sauce on it. I also ordered the mystic mule to drink. It was refreshing and so pretty. My favorite item that we ordered was the  cinnamon roll. It's hard to find desserts that are vegan and actually taste good. I ate every last bite. The restaurant was very edgy and had a cool vibe. Can't wait to go back. It's a must try!

After hearing about this place from my fellow vegan friends and seeing the Instagram posts, I knew I had to check it out for myself. I did expect more of a sit down restaurant type place but it wasn't exactly that. You approach the cashier where there is a menu and a very helpful employee ready to answer any questions. We told her it was our first time there and she politely and patiently took her time explaining the most popular items. 

+ Food is delicious and all made from scratch
+ Every single employee there is super helpful and kind
+ Food didn't take long to come out 
+ Love this location, since it's in the heart of Summerlin

- Water is self-served, so every refill you get yourself
- A server never checks on you throughout your time there  
- Seating isn't super comfortable
- Expensive compared to most other nice vegan cafe's 

Overall, I would definitely recommend this place especially to try at least once. Since I live in Henderson I probably won't make this one of my regular go-to places since it's kind of a hike and Vegenation just opened up next to me.

The food is amazing and the staff makes you never want to leave, one of the most welcoming restaurants I've been to. The food as well is delicious, definitely one of my top recommendations to eat in Summerlin!

Favorite vegetarian resturant!!!
Got the gratitude shake and a bbq burger!!!
Omg love it!
Burgers are legit amazing. One of my favorite spots on the west side. Great Kombucha options as well, highly recommend.

This is one of the restaurants I will eat at twice a week.  The food is clean and delicious.  I don't love their burgers, but the Freekeh bowl and the Ultimate Burrito are amazing. My girlfriend loves the fettuccini dish.  And if the tacos are being served they are also incredible.

I thought this place was going to be really nice and it seemed lovely. However, it has been 15 minutes since I paid and they said they ran out of my order. The only thing they were able to do was give me a meal of comparable price. No refund or any compensation
Well worth the wait! The staff is super friendly and helpful and the vibe when you walk in is welcoming. They have the best kombucha too! Watermelon basil is my favorite!

The food was pretty good. Holds up to their instagram pics. Portion was good. I think it's a little pricey but the food is quality. However, they have that newish system where they swivel the register towards you and put you on the spot to add a tip. Unfortunately I tipped about 5$ because the food for two people came up to about  33$ with no drinks... just food. I thought maybe there was some service to actually tip for. There isn't. A food runner drops it at your table. And get your own silverware by the way. So just to back track a smudge... upon walking into the place there were people standing in front of the register. Thought they were customers. They weren't. They may have been mgmt. but no one greeted us. It almost felt intrusive walking in. We asked a question about what was in the burrito to the guy at the counter.. and he answered. And that was the end of the conversation. There wasn't much customer service basically. No help with the menu which they are still working on.. it's kinda a skeleton menu. No welcome upon entry... no excitement that they had people in their restaurant (it was empty). After we got our food a girl came by to ask how it was.. we literally had the food in front of us for like 2.5 seconds and hadn't even picked up our forks. And then no one ever came back by to actually see how the food was. After getting a take away container we cleaned up our space and left. And there was no "thanks for coming in" or anything like that. I don't know if I would be back regularly or if at all honestly. I would give the food a 3 cause of price...but the service a 2. Which is a bummer. For all you Vegans... check out my review on Go Vegan Cafe! So good!

So I came in for smoothies earlier and saw what a cool design this place and enjoy those smoothies. I had to come back with friends for dinner. I'll plant-based this place is amazing. The food quality of their bowls & how unique they are is wants needed in the Vegan community in Las Vegas! If you want to do your body good  & want to eat plant-based meal, got to try this place simply awesome!

Beautifully prepared vegan food with friendly service!  Took some time for the food to come out, but it was totally worth the wait!  I'm not a vegan but still found the food at Panacea to be delicious and satisfying.... very earthy as another reviewer said. 

The Osaka Burger was pretty damn good... great full flavor profiles.

What a gem! Th ambiance is so chic- chandeliers, velvet chairs, good vibe music. Impressive right when you walk in. 

Kombucharita- strawberry kombucha with berries. Delicious. 

Buffalo cauliflower- like chicken wings, but better for you. And the side white sauce was a great add on, with the cauliflower or celery sticks. 

Freekah bowl- I got this to go to eat on the plane. So many fresh veggies over Moroccan rice. Can't go wrong ordering this. 

If I came back, I'd get the kale salad. 

I also ordered the energy balls in their glass display, I'd say pass on these at $2.50/one. 

Bit pricey, but I'd say worth it for the fresh ingredients you get!

The smoothies and acai bowls are delicious. Those are the only thugs I've tried so far and I plan to be back. The acai bowls are not on the menu anymore but they can still make them for you if you ask.

First of, I'm very happy to find another vegan place in summerlin. This is exciting. So far I like everything I saw in the menu and the food we ordered but I stopped for a moment and I asked myself if I am in NEw York looking at the prices! Then I felt the hot air breeze from outside and realized I'm in Vegas but not on the vegas strip. We spent almost $30 each for all the food in the picture and it's not a lot. That is the 3 star for. And I did not even get my receipt.

If you like Apple in your smoothie get the green smoothie but if you don't, just like me tell them to make your green citrus smoothie without apple. The brown rice bowl is good but for some reason we didn't finish it because something is missing. Hopefully they will do something about their prices and would like to comeback and try other dishes.

My Boyfriend and I eat out a lot and this is our favorite spot .  We have tried everything on the menu and it's all delectable . Best Veggie Burger Ever !!!! Today's special , the African Kale  Stew was Scrumptious .  The Staff is Cool and Professional

First off my wife and I are not Vegan but we have tried being vegan or vegetarian for periods of time. We ate here today and we were both very disappointed.  

We had a love burger and an entree salad.  The burger seemed like it was one single consistency all the way through. I never really could appreciate the patty.  

The entree salad was just a huge pile of spring mix, a few carrot pieces and one seed of some sort. Literally one seed. Maybe it wasn't supposed to be there.

I have been to a lot of vegan places here in Vegas and there all were hit or miss! But this place right here is amazing! I had the bbq burger, it was so good flavor wis and it even felt like a real burger! My lady had the frika bowl and it was top notch as well! Recommend you all try this if your ever in the vegas! Hats off to the staff and the chefs!
I was excited to go to panacea and try their smithies and food...the prices are ridiculous. I decided to get a smoothie and they basically gave me a kid's cup $9!! No panacea for me.

Had there Ultimate vegan burger and it was pretty tasty, maybe not the best veggie burger I've had but it's decent. I also had their vegan hosted cupcake and it was just okay. It was quite airy and crumbly. I found that it tends to get stuck on the top of your mouth which made it a bit strange to eat. Overall my meal was okay, but I probably won't be going back for seconds as it didn't really hit the spot and the cost is a bit high.

nice setting, menu and top quality food.
Counter order and grab a seat and they'll bring it to you.
Great find in a realtivly new outdoor mall. Bowls were great and well packed, burgers looked even more so.

Panacea brings healthy to another level,

great food

fair prices

very attentive service

Try the "Torta" Passion fruit tastes like a real meat sandwich
Went here for the first time and had the bbq burger and the chili cashew cheese fries. Wow what an amazing homemade quinoa burger.

This dinning experience is a little more unique rather than your typical outing. Panacea is a very popular, newly opened, rustic plant- based restaurant located in Summerlin's Boca Park in Las Vegas, NV. Uses only the best quality ingredients & delicious flavors that compliment every dish. The décor is beautiful and modernized with a touch of urban feel. You won't find another place like this in the Valley.

Kombucha on tap
Mocktails
Created by their talented mixologists.
Delicious smoothies
Dishes are complimented with color and taste
Bowls and salads
Healthy desserts
. . .More items will be coming soon to the menu.

Overall, I enjoyed the lunch and atmosphere of Panacea. The service was beyond excellent. So helpful and informative as they took me through their menu while ordering. For the experience it is worth checking-out but I honestly do not see myself coming often. But of course, it is the price you pay for healthy eating/living. Everything is great, but the price is too expensive for me to eat here all the time. I would drop by for some quick dessert or a wellness drink on occasion.

Going back today for lunch and sweet desserts! Fresh, plant-based goodness in every menu item. Keep an eye on special events that are sure to generate a healthy, positive glow to your spirit - finally can recommend Panacea as not only a nutritious pharmacy, but a place to learn about happiness and kindness. This will be my next party venue for sure!

THIS PLACE IS OWNED/OPERATED BY A BUNCHA GD HIPPIES

And that's quite alright, a blessing in fact, because this troupe isn't the stereotyped dirty, aloof ilk. They're clean cut, have refined taste and exacting standards, and are a long-anticipated welcome to an otherwise depressing salad/vegetarian scene in Las Vegas. They're reinventing vegetarian casual dining on their own terms, and reintroducing us commoners to what it means to be a Modern Hippy. 

"But Kevin, isn't a salad just a salad?" 

NO. 
Well, once upon a time, it was. No longer. Your salads at Panacea will be fine crafted works of art. That is no exaggeration, a precise portrayal. 
Someone frame this before I fork it up. 
The photos we're posting from our luncheon aren't exceptions; they are the rule. My Cracked Freekeh salad was, no joke, the best salad I've had (and I hate superlatives). I'm a sucker for kalamata olives, and that tapenade warmed that chilled vege side of my Vegas heart. The roasted elements? Perfect char that didn't dominate the flavor, only accentuating it. And them roasted red peppers! 

You'll notice the salads' featured elements adorn their own private space in the bowls and on the plates. The aesthetics of this operation are primo, and the palate affect is that you get to taste each of the featured items in your particular dish, while also being free to mix&match those flavors per your prerogative. Get creative! Engage your salad!

For my drink, I had a looseleaf green tea, with a saucer of honey on the side to sweeten. Clean, perfect. I have wished for a looseleaf tea spot since moving to Vegas a year ago. And soon they'll carry pu-erh, my go-to tea favorite. 

This is day 1 of their official opening. There are some kinks to work out, as it took a half hour for my salad to arrive, music was a touch loud for conversation, and the dude serving tea at the front was chatting on his cell instead of engaging customers. BUT, the chef was making the rounds and visited our table to see how we were enjoying. Maximum enjoyment. And the delay on my salad? The owner made good on the delay, which was much appreciated. 

Atmosphere and upstairs: comfortable, accommodating. 
Service: a little flustered for having so few people in house, but they're stressed from opening, I'm sure, and things will work out in a week or two. 
Smoothies: had the Divine Feminine, and she was in fact. Healthy, not heavy, not saccharine sweet. The fruit alone was the sweetener with no trashy extras thrown in. Win. 

Definitely will be back, and will definitely recommend to health-minded people looking for a serious upgrade to the garbage vege fast-food chain places in the area (you know who you are, places). Very satisfied with everything had.  Victory!

One of my favorite vegan restaurants in town. Buffalo cauliflower is amazing. Kambucha drink with fruit is delish. I've had many things on the menu and everything is always perfect. Everyone I bring with me loves it and they aren't vegan. You really can't go wrong with anything you order. Everything is great here including the service and atmosphere. Keep up the good work! Panacea Rocks!

I was super pleased at my experience eating here on Sunday. I went in between lunch and dinner so it was not crowded. The attendant was helpful in reassuring me the food was vegan, she recommended the Love Burger. So that's what I ordered along with the cupcake and carrot cake (It was for 3 people to share, although I'm not ashamed to say I would do it all over again just for me) 
The burger and fries were really good, the cupcake was dry and I missed the cream filling but that carrot cake! Hello Gorgeous! It was moist and sweet with out being ridiculous. 

I'll definitely eat here again so I can try something else.

P.S. Apparently to the bathrooms are pretty impressive, per my Mom and 8 year old.

FINALLY, a health conscious vegan spot in Summerlin! The anticipation for this place was intense and all of the hype over Panacea had my expectations pretty high. I've been following Panacea's Instagram for several months preceding the opening and every time I saw a post I'd get giddy. 
Well, today was the day! I finally convinced my omnivorous boyfriend to come with me and try it out. 

Pros: 
1. Food is freakin' ridiculously good. I had the veggie burger and my boyfriend had one of the rice bowls. My burger was SCRUMPTIOUS! The best vegan burger of my life. Boyfriend was amazed by his rice bowl and even went as far to say that he would go vegan if I could make him that every day. :o 
Oh guess I need to learn how to cook!!

Moving on,
I also had the vegan hostess cupcake for dessert and that... that was divine. They should sell entire full sized hostess cakes for they are that yummy. 
The rest of the menu items looked great and I hope to come in again and try more! 

2. Decor is so cute, and the owl mural is even more gorgeous in person. There's even some locally made crystal jewelry for sale as well as some goodies from Herbally grounded. 

3. Service was fast, friendly, and accommodating. 

Cons:
1. As others have mentioned, this place is expensive. All 3 items came out to a little over $40. Now, with that said, it is obvious that there is a certain level of culinary artistry going into these recipes-a kind of artistry that will require GREAT ingredients that sequentially mean more expensive dishes. Not a huge con, but it's worth mentioning.


In conclusion, I loved this place! So many things I didn't try though! A mocktail is definitely a must for next time. 
Thanks Panacea! Glad to have such a rad establishment in the community.

Owner has absolutely no shame, has hit on my wife in front of me...And my daughter's have made similar comments in sure his name is Shane...something like that 
Will not be coming back

Finally!! A REAL healthy, fresh, and beautiful restaurant!! Such passionate owners and staff as well amazing food and drinks!! Panacea will change lives! It's indescribable, you have to go and check out the menu and see what they are about. I promise you will not be disapointed! Try there kombacha mule. Amazing!!!!!!!!

The food here is probably the most delicious plant based food I've tasted. Yet it is made so healthy. The kale salad was full of fresh everything - and was flavored with seaweed. I also got the rutabagas sunchokes. This was soooo good. On top of this the cupcake muffins were actually healthy- not too sweet. I also got a veggie burger which was probably the best I've had in a while. 
The only thing that really wasn't that great and that prevents me from going back there... Is that it's just very expensive for a place that's a very casual eatery.

This has been by far the best vegan meal I've had, a little on the pricey side, but definitely worth it. The Osaka Burger and Ultimate Burrito were outstanding, I can't wait to go back and try everything else on their menu. The only thing keeping me from giving this place 5 stars was one of the girls ringing us up had a bad attitude when we asked questions about the menu. Other than that, I can get over it, because I loved the food so much.

I absolutely fell in love with this place! Great ambience and decor!!! Food was delicious! We got the nachos, 2 burgers, chili burrito, kale salad, cupcakes and cookies. I even got a CBD drink for later;) Worth the drive to Summerlin 100% !
Great food, great vibe, awesome staff. I live just around the corner and go there a lot, it feels like home now. Highly recommend the turmeric latte and any of the food.
This place is so great . Atmosphere is a 10 food is a 10 and  service is a 10 . I can get work done here and just feel so comfortable. Best vegan place . TRY THE JUICES

The menu had so many options and the meals are each a wonderful experience of flavors and nutrients. The staff was is warm, professional, and knowledgeable. I still can't get over how amazing the watermelon basil kombucha is.

Love  this place! So happy I found a truly healthy place with ingredients like maca, beet root, turmeric, lucuma, and elderberry.  I had the sacred temple smoothie, rutabaga and sun choke brava  and nachos. I look forward to coming back!
LOVE THE ATMOSPHERE!! Not to mention the buffalo cauliflower is absolutely delish! We will definitely be back. :)

I had to come check this place out with my girl, and I was absolutely thrilled at the great quality dishes they have.. customer service is amazing, and the food is delicious.. I love the burgers and The gratitude smoothie!! It's a must to go there!!

I only participate in the plant-based lifestyle on a part-time basis, but I've been eagerly anticipating the opening of Panacea! The location and food are beautiful, their aesthetic and attention to detail throughout are as nice as the high-quality eats. Service is warm and friendly, but speed is not their forte so come when you have time to chill and relax in their colorful, cozy space. 

Of their "green bowls", I've had the 118* Chopped Salad ($12) with all the vegetables in the house in a delicious warm shallot thyme vin dressing. It's super fresh with tons of textures!
Their Cracked Freekeh and 8 Grain Rice "grain bowls" are more filling, but also full of fun flavor pairings. The curry-tinged beet puree is especially enjoyable. 
I'm less into smoothies, and the Divine Femininity was nicely light and floral with rose water but thinner than I personally prefer my blended beverages. They also have "medicinal cocktails" and tea services available. And yes, they do have honey, which some hardcore vegans have absolutely no chill about. Panacea does not claim to be vegan, just plant-based, so look out for your dietary needs here as you would anywhere else.

In addition to eats and drinks, Panacea has events (find them on social media) and a small gift shop area with jewelry, literature, and essential oils for your favorite plant-powered person!

Uses conventional fruit in so-called organic smoothies? What else is a lie? ... At first we thought it was a nice place, and the meal was good. We had the burger and nachos. Too much on the fermented purple cabbage/onion or whatever that was in both Love Burger and Nachos, but delicious overall. Didn't have a decaf coffee - that's a minus. Be sure to provide a decaf for pregnant women and those not wanting caffeine. Then we decided to get 2 cupcakes at the counter. They didn't have a plate to put cupcakes on (!!!), so we waited for like 10 minutes for the other girl to come out with a plate (and somebody else's order from the kitchen), and we carried our dessert back upstairs where we were sitting. Our dirty plates from nachos and burger were still all over the table, so we had to move them ourselves and try and enjoy the cupcakes. So while we were waiting for the plate to put out cupcakes on, that's when I saw her put conventional grapes in the so-called organic smoothies. She said that they don't always use organic ingredients in this "organic" eatery... I asked her if they at least avoid genetically modified organisms in this "organic" eatery, and she looked at me and tells me she has no idea how the ingredients are sourced. WELL, damn it, then don't call yourself organic. OR better yet, train your staff and communicate to it such basic information as the standards for the ingredients you use. Needless to say, ANYTHING that's made in the blender where pesticides covered conventional stuff is being blended cannot be called organic. So, Panacea, please, either commit to honest food standards and labels, or spare us the bs. We drove there FOR organic vegan food; not some lack of transparency about what we put in our bodies. Our lousy government is already doing enough of that; I don't drive to a so-called organic vegan restaurant for more food scam.

A great addition to Boca Park! 
Everything about Panacea was great - service, aesthetic/decor, menu, everything! 
My friend got the Ultimate Burrito and I got the Osaka Burger.... WOW the Osaka Burger is one of the best burgers I've ever had... and I'm not vegan! It's definitely not your typical meaty/greasy burger okay, but it's flavor is amazing and that's what puts itself in its own burger category! Haha I highly highly recommend. We also got the chocolate strawberry cake dessert and it was delicious!! Yes, prices are a bit more steep, but everything is made fresh and with high quality produce so it's expected

Panacea, opened only months ago, is quickly making a name for themselves. As you walk in you are welcomed by a simplistic earthy art vibe and two different seating areas which allows you to find a quiet spot to get work done or catch up with a friend. Although the prices are on the high end, you can find almost anything on the menu from coffee, smoothies, wellness shots to tasty meals and treats - almost all vegetarian or vegan friendly. The focus of the menu is offering fresh ingredients and healthy alternatives - keeping everything simple but full of flavor. The staff seemed a bit stand offish but I enjoyed my smoothie and will definitely come back to try more!

I absolutely love the food at this place but I definitely think it's overpriced for the amount of food that you get. Well the quality is good sometimes I find myself just wanting more after I'm finished eating because there wasn't necessarily enough in the beginning. The staff is really friendly and the place is always clean so I'll definitely come back I just wish there would be a better balance with cost versus what you get

My wife and I are always looking for healthy alternatives to the usual suspects when dining out.  We found our new favorite.

Panacea has a great range of dishes that are tasty, plentiful and guilt free.  We shared their Asian Osaka burger while sipping on amazing smoothies.  We topped the meal off with a banana bread cupcake and RD velvet cookie.

The servers were friendly and very helpful when trying to choose what to eat.

Great ambience as well.  I can tell everything about this vegan restaurant is handled with loving care.

Love the vibe and set up of this place! Nachos are insanely good and what a huge portion size for the money! Spirulina tea was super yummy like creamy mint and chip. The service was very informative, friendly, and fast! I will be visiting quite often.

I'm no vegan, and admittedly don't eat as healthfully as I should, but I always feel accomplished when I go to Panacea. Like "yeah, I could get down with this healthy vegan stuff!" (Then I go back to eating crap the next day, but at least I tried!)

Back to Panacea. It's kind of a hybrid between fast food and a sit down restaurant. Lots of choices, from smoothies to burgers (vegan), to veggie concoctions. The price point is a little high, but when you're getting all that organic and vegan goodness, it's to be expected. 

The smoothies are really tasty, large sized, and filling! I'd seen complaints about portion sizes, but I didn't find them to be small at all. The sweet potato fries were fantastic, and I got quite a lot of them. And yeah, that Osaka burger is legit! I just had a few bites of my friend's, but man! Juicy and actually "meaty" tasting. The sauce and bread really made it special as well.

Service is friendly and although it could be a bit quicker, I understand that good things take time. 

No, my pockets can't afford Panacea all the time when I want something quick-Ish, but when they can and I feel like getting back on a healthy kick, I go to Panacea!

The Chorizo burrito was tasty but was mostly stuffed with rice. I was still hungry after eating the 14 dollar burrito. I don't mind paying the price for quality but at least throw in a few more beans.

I went here the other night for the 4th time and probably will never go back. Don't get me wrong the interior and food was nice but wayyyy too expensive and most of the time they are out of the only really good entrees on the menu. Its kinda discouraging to go somewhere several times and each time the item you quest is unavailable. Also you can make a veggie burger w/ fries just as good at home for way less than the $18 dollars i paid for other night. The last and Biggest problem with this place is that you have to be a child to request something off the kids menu which makes no sense.... why restrict customers and put something in front of them they can even have? all you're doing is missing out on profit when someone decides to get nothing instead of picking something off the more expensive menu after having all their requests denied. None of the adult shakes or smoothies looked good so I decided not to get one. And after being told that i just decided this place was not worth the money or trip. Telling a customer they cant order a small berry smoothie because they aren't under 12 and letting them walk away without getting anything at all is bad for business in my opinion and just a silly policy in general. One could just simply lie and say they're child is sitting outside. Now that I think of it i should have just fibbed I really wanted that smoothie but its too late now. :(

I am always excited to try new foods and specially plant based. Coming from a plant based house hold and having the ability to work with various spices;  tastes are not complete. 

Its not that food is not of quality or fresh, without a doubt it is. However a bit more needs to be done by the chef so tastes could be complete. 
 
We tried the Osaka bugers and Umami F.. 

Thank you for cooking for us, grateful!

The only thing I'm upset about is that it took me so long to try the food here. Tonight we got take out and each had the Love Burger and Gratitude Juice and it was absolutely delicious.  I will definitely be back.

Food was amazing. Burgers have good flavor and texture.  High quality and fresh food, would come back just for the food. The customer service could use a little work. Don't get me wrong the employees are nice once you stare at them for a couple minutes and say hi. ( there were 4 employees and no other customers).

After months of impatiently waiting, I was excised to finally get to try this place. The acai bowl was one of the best I've ever had - I loved how it was more like scoops
of sorbet than a soupy smoothie bowl. 

I added blackberries and pineapple to the bowl, and I was happy I did, it really made it extra delicious. The decor is awesome, I love the mural wall...really the whole aesthetic. 

They don't serve coffee (at least not yet) but luckily sambalatte is just next door. I didn't get any kombucha on tap this time, but as a huge booch fan I'm really excited they offer it on tap and had 3 flavors to choose from.

I can't wait to try more of their menu options, looking forward to cold pressed juice snow cones!
The food is a little pricey, but totally worth it. I love their buffalo cauliflower its absolutely wonderful, plus they have super good home made treats that are excellent as well as kombucha on tap

Me and my husband came in for dinner & really everything we had a freaking amazing. The owner of this restaurant used to own our most favorite juice bar in Vegas. We ordered the buffalo cauliflower for a appetizer which was so yummy!!! For our main courses we both ordered burgers I got their award winning burger and my husband ordered the BBQ burger and they were both just perfect. Not only was the food good but the people that work here are just really good kind souls. We will definitely be coming back here:)

I just came here for a bite to eat, but was absolutely blown away by the black forbidden rice bowl. The staff is friendly, and every meal I had there has been fantastic! The atmosphere is really nice and the food is worth every penny. I'll be back very soon...

Best Vegan Spot in town. The atmosphere is fantastic and I always meet the best people here. 
I have never had anything I didn't enjoy here but my favorite is the Chili burrito and the burgers are fantastic.

I would rate the food 5 stars but the customer service a 1- and the main reason my wife and I are hesitant to return. I am an experienced yoga instructor exposed to a lot of elitist attitudes in the vegan/conscious health community (those "my life is better than yours, you should be like I am" demeanors), and by their Instagram/Facebook posts I got the impression that this place worked against that type of pretentious egocentrism, and possibly offered an open space for all walks of life, but we found ourselves on the defense when attempting to rearrange a menu item because of some food allergies. It took a lot of patience to bypass the cashier's judgmental/condescending tone and demeanor to calmly explain and complete our order. If they drop the heavy opinions, downward eyes, and let the ingredients do the talking, Summerlin AND Vegas, have a true winner within them. I really want this place to thrive and do well and spearhead this type of cuisine for our future so DO visit for the food but lay down your expectations for friendly open service and you'll love it.
Plant based burger was fire but the price point is ridiculous. Wanted to go back for seconds but hell it was 20 sum odd dollars for a small burger I think not. Very tasty tho

Casual spot with lots of vegetarian and vegan friendly offerings. Design, Music, Art and offerings all speak to a common vision, very well put together. 
Highlights were roasted sunchoke and rutabaga with smoked paprika aioli, great to see veg dishes that are not pretending to be something they are not. Ginger kombucha on tap was great, green tea also pretty good. Hummus was fresh and yummy, mild in the seasoning dept but good value and portioning. Veg burger actually really speaks to a burger experience, lots of yellow mustard and pickles, I'm not a fan of the commodity bun but I understand its role. Service was probably a bit to casual..
I will 100% return as the offerings are well done enough and plentiful enough to warrant the trip.

Got to enjoy a tasty lunch yesterday here and I was. It surprised on how tasty it was. I had been recommend to go try their veggie burger and damn, I'm glad I did. I love meat, I'm a meat and potato gal, but their veggie burger was so good! I did not miss the meat at all! It was filling and still had me wanting more! A tad expensive but granted it is in boca park. We also tried their kombucha on tap, I felt like it was way too tasty to be healthy haha very good! My real review is for their chocolate chip cookie! Holy cow, can I get a dozen! I'll definitely be going back for that cookie cause that's all I can think about!:) hope that was healthy too... go give them a chance and remember it's just their soft opening right now. Let them get their kinks out.

Kombucha is AMAZING! Also order the Asian style burger (I forgot the exact name of it), it's the best thing on the menu along with a side of cilantro lime fries--well done please :) you won't be disappointed trying this place!

A place that feels like it belongs in California: earthy and peaceful, with a delicious menu and friendly, humble service.

The atmosphere is one that promotes peace. The juices are fantastic, handmade by the down-to-earth staff. Out of place in Vegas but definitely needed, and very much a winner.
Awesome menu with amazing eclectic flavors that lifts my tastebuds. Clean eating never felt so much like comfort food

Panacea does not disappoint! A cute hidden gem amongst the many dining options in Boca Park with a modern hippie vibe. Being from San Diego I find myself gravitating towards local restaurants that serve healthy food. I came here with a friend who is far from vegan however open to trying something new. 

We had the Love Burger, Garden Nachos, Cauliflower Buffalo bites and Trilogy Kombucha. 

First let me say the Love Burger is hands down one of the best veggie burgers I have ever had. The combination of the chipotle ketchup, ginger mustard and pickled onions made this burger absolutely to die for. Secondly, I love that they have kombucha on tap! A unique find in Vegas and definitely worth checking out.

Some of the tastiest Vegan food I've had... So good that non-vegans will easily enjoy. It would be an easy 5 stars if the price point matched the portion size, but more on that later. We'll roll with the positive first. 

Panacea has some great bowls... They start with grains that have a strong protein to carb ratio, include a bunch of fresh veggies, and finish things off with wonderfully tasting sauces or dressings. But the bowls aren't even the tastiest thing I've had here. I'm also a fan of their burgers. In fact, I had to come back recently because I found myself craving their Osaka Burger. I even came in once with a friend that said this was one of the better burgers they have had, and the first vegan burger they have ever truly enjoyed!

My axe-to-grind concerns the portion sizes. My love and I recently spent $45 (including tip) on a couple of burgers with add-ons for lunch...no appetizers, no drinks, certainly not any smoothies, and we both found ourselves hungry a couple hours later. In fact, all three times I've been here, I had issues with the portion sizes comparable to the price of the meal. We certainly don't mind spending money on quality food, but the blatant marring of experience concerning the value (or lack there of) of the meal is the not only the only thing holding them back from 5 stars, but also the only thing that will keep me from coming back anytime soon.
Great spot with friendly staff. My salad was super fresh and my smoothie was amazing. Will be back for sure!

I'm so glad I discovered Panacea so quickly when I got to LV! The food is SO good with my faves be in the buffalo cauliflower, the bowls (crazy nutritious and incredibly aesthetically pleasing!) and the superposition truffles for dessert. They also hold events from meditation to wellness talks upstairs...add them on IG to learn about the events. Love this place, I'm a fan! Clean eating at it's best.

This gorgeous place is amazing! Such amazing food, smoothies and desserts! And yes they are vegan! We had the most delicious plant-based burger! Our smoothies felt like an explosion of flavors that our taste buds were doing a happy dance! We also had the plant-based hostess cupcakes and WOW! I never thought I'd have one again! It was fluffy and I honestly could eat a dozen of them. 

When you first walk in and look right you are greeting by some wall art it's a beautiful masterpiece! They also have art moss wall and I'm in love with it! The light fixtures, brick walls, tables, seating, even their plates were perfectly selected to  fit the ambiance. I will most definitely be visiting Panacea again and again.

Absolutely love this place! Everything about Panacea is great. The environment is super chill and laid back with delicious food. Every time I've gone here I've gotten something different and each plate is real good. I'm so glad this place is only 10 minutes from my work. Even my coworkers who aren't vegan love this place. We've order food from here at least once a week. Definitely recommend for everyone. Plus it is kids friendly! My daughter loved this place too.

Most delicious healthy food I have ever had! I ordered the Osaka burger with french fries and it was a flavor bomb in my mouth! There were so many dimensions of flavor between the pickle cabbage, sautéed mushrooms, avocado, and green onions. The flavor of the patty itself was to die for. 

It was a tad pricey (burger was $15 and kombucha was $7), but well worth it. There is also always a  long wait usually despite how busy it is. Very friendly staff and love the fact they have an upstairs and downstairs, gives it a casual yet trendy and homey feel.

I also recommend the hummus bowl and buffalo cauliflower!!!
This was a different type of food which was well worth waiting for. The atmosphere & service was impeccable.

OMG! I have officially fallen in love with this place. It's gorgeous! Everything about it is just perfect. The art work on the walls, the brick work, the lights, the 2nd level flooring, I'm telling you everything! 

I had been following this place for a while now on Instagram and also another person on Instagram who raves about this place. Since I've been transitioning to a more plant based diet, I have been searching around town for some good plant based food, and I think I finally found it! 

I came here with my kids spontaneously just to try it out. So I ended up ordering 
- 2 lemon sugar cookies
- Sweet Berry Smoothie
- Banten Honey Oolong Tea
- Love Burger with Vegan Cheese

Now the kids liked the flavor of the lemon cookies, however they were a bit too hard on their little teeth. The sweet berry smoothie was delicious! The kids loved it. I enjoyed my Tea, however I prefer it to be a bit more sweet, just my preference. And as far as the burger, I ordered the love burger, but received the Ultimate Burger instead. Not a problem for me, the more the merrier. Especially since I was sharing the burger with my kids. I asked the server for a side of Sriracha. Now let me just say, that burger was the BEST plant Based burger I have ever ate. Like ever! The texture was so on point and it was super moist and flavorful. I didn't even need the Sriracha Sauce honestly. It was really just that good. I could literally eat it every single day.  I will definitely be going back for the burger for sure!


Now you guys are probably wondering why I gave this place a 4 star rating. Well as much as I would love to give this place 5 stars I just can't because of the service. The staff was super friendly, however service was extremely slow. I received my burger over 25 minutes after I placed and paid for my order. I felt like they had forgotten about my burger at one point. I ended up taking my things from my table and going down to one of the tables on the lower level just so I could be seen.  I also felt like the staff was still learning the menu and the placing of things. And I got the ultimate burger rather than what I ordered which was the love burger. Now I really don't mind about getting the wrong burger, because I was beyond satisfied with it. However there was only one other customer in the entire restaurant during the time I placed my order, so I honestly don't understand how they could get the order wrong. And I don't understand how they took so long to give me my burger either, given that there was basically no one there. 

Now I know this spot is rather new, so that is expected. I will definitely be returning soon and recommending it to others. Can't wait to give this place a 5 star rating!

Yep! I LOVED IT!  Shane made a special elixir with a "kick" in it.  It was very good, and will go on the menu- look for something with strawberries in the name.  I had the standard burger, and my friend had the Asian burger.  We both devoured them and then chatted to catch up.  The prices are up there, but worth it for the taste, and how you feel the rest of the day.  Give it a shot, be kind as they open to full speed.

Had the chili burrito and my boyfriend had the ultimate burrito. Yum!  The chili burrito has fries and chili sauce making it the best "chili" I've had since switching to vegan. I wish I had gotten the salad, next time!  The ultimate burrito was the perfect blend of flavors.  Loved the decor too. Will definitely be back!

I really love this place. The ultimate burger is amazing. One day I will try something new but it's so good......it's all I've ordered so far. The other day my burger wasn't as perfect as it usually is so I complained......the waiter, the owner, and the cook fixed the issue immediately and were all so polite and professional about it. They really appreciate their customers and put quality into every plate. The BEST vegan cheeseburger I've ever had.
The food is so good! The buff cauliflower bomb and the ranch,  I'm not even vegan! Had it at cpk and not good! Also their burgers are amazing i loved it! Can't wait to go back!

After my 4th visit I decided to do a review.  Let me start off by saying:
I can taste the quality and I appreciate the creativity... what is hard to swallow are the prices.  
I will still eat at Panacea, absolutely.  It just won't be my go-to...

Cracked freekah bowl (x2) A+
BBQ Burger A+
Nachos B
Seriously my favorite restaurant. I come here alllll the timmmmeee. Try their love burger if you don't know what to get. It's my absolute favorite.

In town for work and came across Panacea as a local vegan spot. Of all the vegan spots this one seemed to have the most 4-5 solid stars. My assumption was this place would be my best local bet. Meh, I was left unimpressed. I ordered the forbidden grain bowl, immediately disappointed because they were out of sweet potatoes and subbed in with zucchini. Aside from that, everything else was lacking flavor or actually not even in the dish. As I sat there eating the flavorless dish, I was thinking that there were other ingredients missing. I looked on their menu and actually three other ingredients were missing. So I paid $15 for something that didn't have any appealing taste and was half of what it should have been? Throw on some salt, pepper and garlic - you'd have some super simple flavor added. I'm not sure if I'll be back the next time I'm in town.

I work in Boca Park & my vegan options are limited. With Panacea opening up in Boca Park, I now have tons of items to choose from daily. Service is awesome, restaurant is always very clean, and the food is consistently wonderful.

There are lots of food choices there at Boca Park. If your belly is wanting something healthy and you just got paid, then I'd try Panacea. Healthy food menu consists of:apps, burgers, sides, salads, smoothies, juices, and desserts.
There are some tables outside, and few near the kitchen, and a few upstairs. I like the view upstairs- calm and peaceful. 
I tried a smoothie, and 2 apps and my total was 24$- that's a big ouch for me. I liked the spice of the buffalo cauliflower and my carrot smoothie was refreshing. My side of Brussels sprouts didn't really please my taste buds due to the sauce that was used. I left it untouched. 
Service was minimally friendly. The place was clean and got super busy as we were leaving. 
I would be back to meet up with a friend, but my budget won't be able to handle frequent visits.
Overpriced with mediocre food. Located in Boca Park, serving up overly hyped vegan food to the athlesuire Summerlin Moms is pretty much how I would sum this place up.
It's okay. The cookies are hard as bricks. The bowls are good. Everything here is pretty average. The service is great though!

It was my first time and they're still working out the kinks. My food was excellent but I almost waited 30 minutes for it. I had the brown bowl.... so delicious and full of flavor! My BFF had the ultimate burger... I wish I took  photo of it... it was amazing! I really was looking forward to the desserts and breakfast options featured on their social media page... but unfortunately... not available yet. I'll be back... and hopefully things will be up and running.
Newly opened Panacea is a beautiful place with even more beautiful food. The watermelon basil kombucha is heaven.

The food is very tasty. Very good burger that is not listed on the menu yet. This place just opened so they are still working on the menu and prices. Kombucha on tap was $5 our first time and when we came back a week later they are now $6.99. Service was really bad today. No help when we walked in and food was served cold. Hopefully they will get organized soon.

I'm not too happy about my meal today . I ordered the ultimate burrito which was 14.50 and was all mushy with no flavor and came out soggy ! Usually I like the food . I order the Osaka burger And hummus bowl. Today I wanted to try something new and I was very displeased .

Love it here! Thank you Shane and the Panacea crew. Awesome plant-based burger that came with a small salad! Also had a green smoothie. Staff so friendly and always have updates and new items on their social media outlets. Enjoy!

This is, by far, the absolute best place I have EVER eaten at. I've eaten all over the world but never have I had such flavorful food. Not to mention plant based! This place is so amazing it's almost too good to be true! The prices (although many might say "overpriced") are great for what is given. High quality food and they also serve a good amount (unlike gourmet restaurants on the strip). Great job, Panacea.
Food is AWEEEEESOME! The staff is friendly and answer all your questions. It has always been clean. I could have the gratitude smoothie 3 times a day. Love this place.

"Where in Boca Park is it? That restaurant space that has a new place every 7 months?" Quote from my boyfriend when telling him I wanted to check them out. 

I hope they last and keep business going because the food was really good albeit pricey for what it is. The burger was really good and has that smokey flavor one looks for in a burger. $1.00 upcharge for cheese, $2 for fries. I can see why people are upset over the prices. Ten dollars for a smoothie is ridiculous I don't care what's inside. No smoothie is that expensive to make. We ordered the sprouts and got the cauliflower instead due to the cashiers mistake. I'm surprised at the way the issue was handled. Usually in Vegas, especially the restaurant industry, if a mistake is made the customer either gets their money back OR you bring out the correct item which is what we would have preferred but it never happened. We asked for a small side of sprouts and were told they'd be out and after waiting 25 minutes for them we decided to leave.

I'll come back and hopefully have a smoother experience.

This review is for 2.5 stars. 

Panacea has a really great veggie burger. But that's where the good news stops. I ordered a burger to go and added some cheese. I was given an eta of 20 minutes so I came in paid and sat down. Total wait time from calling in my order to leaving the restaurant was 45 minutes. I never got updates or any type of apology. Then I open the box and the burger looks drabby and the salad and dressing alike was meshing with the burger to give it a non-enticing sogginess. If it wasn't for the great quinoa patty this place would be closer to 1.5 stars. With a $1 charge for cheese, my meal came out to an unbelievable $17.  This my first and last time ever at Panacea.

Let me make this real simple for you...walk in...order the Chili Cheese Fries for starters, then order the  Ultimate Burger with the side salad...try the "GRATITUDE" smoothie...all VEGAN by the way...and walk out with a very satisfied tummy. Why not 5 stars you ask? The price...while not bad it is a little expensive for the actual portions you get...but I still recommend this location for all Vegans and Vegetarians for that matter. Eat, Drink, and be Merry, my Friends!!!!

Omg the food is delicious, a little on the high price but it worth it for the great taste. The burgers are great, the chili was great but when I mix it all together some rice pieces where still raw hard. The drinks are good, not so much the rose waters but the smoothies are to die for. The restaurant is clean and friendly.

Delicious fresh food can be found here at Panacea we had the burger and chili fries. The Chili Fries are out of this world delicious and also the Gratitude green smoothie that tastes like lemonade is amazing. Treat yourself and have a great meal at Panacea. The staff was helpful and their service was gracious. Parking can be challenging because of all the great shops in this shopping area.

Great service, vibes, and burgers!  Shared an ultimate burger and buffalo cauliflower with my hunny yesterday. You can tell the burger patties are grain based and they are so yummy with quinoa and barley throughout. Definitely will be back.
Meetup spot of all the enlightened glalactics in town. Best vegan spot in town hands down.

Came here with my friends a couple weeks ago. I ordered the Garden Nachos and the Divine Feminine smoothie. Both were 10/10. Nachos were a very good portion so me and 2 other friend's ate them together. They have a selection of Rose Water by the cashier's counter. They have 2 levels and we chose to sit at the 2nd level because no one was up there. If you're experiencing with becoming a vegan, I definitely recommend this place- been craving it ever since.
Did think i would like a vegan restaurant but this was really good with large portions. Interesting flavors and colorful food. Very delicious and hearty. Will be back.

Giving this a 2.5 stars. The burger and ketchup, while over priced were really good.  However, it took 30 minutes to get two burgers and there were only 4 other tables full. The fries that we paid 2.50 extra for were served cold and soggy.  The vinaigrette on the salad was to tart. We asked for no pickels on one of the burgers although had to pick them off because they were on there anyway. Lastly, I have great vision and the menu on the wall was written way too small.

Food gets a 4 star.  The price gets a 2 star. It was $60 for lunch. They up charge for fries and also for dipping sauce for said fries. Maybe will give it another try but hope they bring down the prices.

Wow! An alcohol free and amazingly friendly atmosphere. Sarah, Sheena, Nick, and well another amazing barista/everything employee, made my son (8) feel like family from the second we walked in. 

We shared a smoothie that tasted like mint chocolate chip ice cream. It had a hint of coffee and was a 10 star out of 5. This will be a new weekly boys day out treat from now on. The
Menu is all healthy and looks delicious. I'll update with names of plates or smoothies we have from now on. 

It was funny I could swear they added happiness and relaxation spray into the ventilation system. I asked Sarah what they put in the air and she laughed with me and said nothing. I think hey are secretly putting someone in the air:-)

The prices are very reasonable as well.

I have been to Panacea three times now, and this last time has been my best experience yet. My boyfriend mom and I all ordered at the counter. The person behind the counter was very cheerful and kind. You could tell that she actually cared for her job and the customer experience. 

After we ordered our food we sat down upstairs. I love that they had water and silverware accessible everywhere. It really helped ensure the community vibe. The lighting is dim and the artwork is beautiful. This is definitely a place you can bring your laptop or a good book to and just enjoy the vibes. 

The first dish that arrived was the cauliflower wings. They were incredible and the ranch was definitely the best part. Shortly after we got the burrito, spinach noodles, and burger. All three of us shared everything, and EVERYTHING was delicious. 

The whole experience was amazing. The kind staff, the ambiance, the incredible food. If there was one thing I would like to see change it would be the prices, or at least offering lower $$ items on the menu. Other than that this place is great!

The food is amazing. I've tried a bunch of stuff but yesterday my friend and I shared a starter, main and desert and it was all amazing! We had the edamame, Asian burger and the chocolate cake! Do yourself a favor and order the exact same thing! You will thank me!!!

This is the most amazing vegan food on the plant! The salads, veggie burgers, and rice bowls will keep you coming back for more and more. Completely hooked and I live in Henderson!!!! They have delicious smoothies and mock tails, weekend evening there is a ultra cool DJ. For dessert try the "hostess" cupcake. Panacea please open on the East Side!

The style, layout and vibe of Panacea is definitely what makes it such a gem! Kudos to them for branding the place to look super hip but not like a hippie vegan spot! The menu is just a tad higher than I anticipate to pay, but all of the food was tasty and fresh. I would like to see an extended menu, and we are still waiting on that liquor license!

Wow!! I've been meaning to come here for quite sometime And I finally made it there this evening. it's easily become my favorite spot. I like to stay pretty plant based and this is pretty much the only place in Las Vegas that is worthwhile as far as plant based options go. I can't wait to come back and try more food. As I walked in, I happened to notice a review on their burger and it said, "who needs in n out?" Well.... I share that exact same
Sentiment after trying their love burger! My gf and I split their burger and fettuccine dish. That burger is out of this world. The fettuccine is different than your traditional kind but it was fantastic. If your taste buds are open to this type of food- it's a MUST! If they're not.... well, start opening them up because you're really missing out on some awesome alternatives that help keep our planet and fellow animals happy! I'm already dreaming about my next meal here!

BEST VEGGIE BURGER I've had yet!  It had the taste of a traditional meat burger, the texture and grill flavor, and is offered several different ways.  The bun isn't gluten free for those wondering but you can make it a wrap or on a salad.  We opted for the sweet potato fries instead of the side salad, fries were seasoned and not overly done. 
  The hummus bowl was another hit.  A good creamy texture, not overly dry, served with pita bread and veggies for dipping and topped with sesame seeds.
Food here is delicious... I wish they had another location near Downtown!

I am a regular next door at Sambalatte, it's one of my favorite places to grab a cup of coffee and knock out a ton of work. Their downside is that they don't have many food options for people who are vegitarian and gluten feee so one of their employees told me about Panacea which is right next door. Let me tell you, if you are a health conscious eater (allergies and restrictions aside) this is a place you should try. Their menu looks a little intimidating with items you wouldn't generally see at a typical restaurant but don't be scared to give it a try. Everything I've had here so far has been phenomenal, you can't go wrong with anything on the menu! Also, their atmosphere is perfect for a date lunch, dinner or even getting some work done on your laptop! I just wish they had more comfortable seating upstairs and maybe a few table games.

If you're looking for a nice modern spot to have a juice and maybe a healthy bite to eat and you're in the area, this is not bad. They have a good variety of drinks and the two that we tried were nice but I've definitely been to other juice places with a similar vibe that have a bigger variety and better product.

A NON BIASED REVIEW: Had great food & service the first time, and just terrible food & service the second time, especially for Cheesecake Factory like pricing. Burgers, sunchoke, aioli & chocolate cake on the first visit were phenomenal! Albeit $9 for a small dessert seemed a bit too pricey, but I understand that vegan substitution can mean higher cost-margins. Had the fresh spinach fettuccine the second time around and it was a waste of $15 and a complete disappointment--way too undercooked, sticky, greasy and just bland. I wonder how or why this is even on the menu because it's very amateur, just because the pasta is fresh doesn't mean it's good, yes?! My husband's side of fries was cold & stale and the extra side of aioli was forgotten. We also ordered a regular black-drip, which the cashier said they had (off the menu) and then were served & charged $6.50 for a small cold-brew that was beyond bitter for regular coffee let alone a cold-brew, no cream or sweetener was offered either! Lastly, after taking my plate to the bar asking for a to-go box the girl behind the counter just handed me the box instead of boxing it for me after I actually had to take the plate to her, and so I ended up boxing it myself over the cash register while she was waiting for me, then handed her the plate--very awkward & rude! Staff needs more training, especially their Thursday night staff in taking orders correctly & hospitality. Basically, for the prices they charge (meaning sit-down prices for hip, cafe style dining) I hope to see great improvement in service at least! Deducting 1.5 stars for service and .5 stars for pricing in relation to cafe like dining; the POS says it all, we do not remember receiving a receipt either or being asked if we wanted one (second visit). However, I would like to finish on a good note, and say that the burgers are gourmet and worth every penny, and I just love their sunchoke & aioli (very reasonably priced too). My recommendation to the owners: add more reasonably priced light seasonal items to the menu like the sunchoke, frugivores compared to omnivores don't need much food to feel satisfied, or change to a bistro (small restaurant) style dining experience with a waiter, if not, at least a designated hospitality employee; the gourmet experience is a bit off at the moment.

Will visit again and update review, if we notice a change in service.

The best vegan burger I've ever eaten. We ordered two different burgers and shared them, one was great and the other even better. YuM! Great smoothie selection as well. Friendly staff that will help you if you are new to plant based foods. Can't wait to eat here again!
This place had amazing flavor! I'm vegetarian and loved the food and my friend who isn't vegetarian even loved the food!
Amazing food. I highly recommend the burger!! We visit from San Diego and make sure to always stop by for lunch!!

I got a smoothie. It was good and refreshing especially on a hot summer day. Even though a little pricey. There are also a lot of places you can sit. They also have a upstairs loft if you need to study.

I'll start off by saying part of me really wants to give this place a 5 star review. I can't seem do a 3 1/2 star review, so I'm giving it 4 stars. It's hard to judge from a single experience and I like to give the benefit of the doubt. I will definitely go again and this time, just be more vocal about anything I feel isn't quite right. 

So here's my review, as well as POV on some of the objections others have made in their reviews. 

1) Location: I'm staying in Summerlin with my mom. She likes a lot of the vegan food I make (I'm pretty handy in the kitchen), but is definitely an omnivore and often not satisfied when I bring her to vegan restaurants. Having a nice place like this, close to our airbnb and also close to other omni places for those who really just want a burger or pizza is a huge plus. There's nothing worse than feeling like you're making the people you're with go out of their way to accommodate your plant-based preference. 5 stars for location

2) Price: True, it's not cheap. Then again, what great vegan places are? It's on par with similar plant-based places I've been in Asheville, NC, Florida and even Cali. 

For the money, the food was clearly very fresh & thoughtful, and the veggies were flavorful. It's also Vegas...everything's more expensive here and they need to make sure they can pay rent and employees to stay open. 

I had Bufflalo Cauliflower $9 + rosemary reg fries $4 (headsup, they're shoestring fries!). Mom had the cracked freekeh bowl $14 with the virgin feta $1 (which they forgot to add and we didn't even notice until we were nearly full). 

Total 2 meals, no drinks or extras, ~$30 + tip. Not cheap, but we surely would have spent AT LEAST that if I'd bought groceries at Whole Foods to make this dinner myself. + we had freekeh bowl leftovers. 

3.5 stars for Price.

3) Food & Service: Chelsea helped us and was really sweet and pleasant. She answered all my questions about the food really well and accommodated us as newbies, letting us grab a seat at the bar with the printed menus while we decided and then just putting our order in for us without making us get back up and wait in line.

We came after an evening yoga class and were really hungry...I was actually craving buffalo cauliflower....BAM it was on their menu. Sold. 

Many other reviews complained about the speed. This was NOT an issue for us, in fact the food came out so fast it surprised us! That said, we the roasted veggies in the freekeh bowl as well as my buffalo cauli were a tad undercooked. The eggplant couldn't really be eaten (don't eat raw or semi-raw nightshades!) the rest was just very al dente, but also tasty. I was ok with the buffalo cauli, but now having seen some photos from others, I'm sure it wasn't fully roasted. Now I'll know to just say something next time. Mom still really enjoyed her food but commented it could have been a bit more seasoned. 

As they were making smoothies for other customers, they gave us each a little sample which was really nice and we enjoyed them both. The raspberry (?) one was really yummy and the green one (x-something) was light, refreshing and not overly sweet. 

Chelea also checked in on us a couple times and genuinely seemed to want our feedback as they're still pretty new. Food+Service 3-3.5 stars, second chance pending...

Suggestions for Restaurant: 

- Be sure when people order they know they're supposed to self-serve water and get their own cutlery and napkins by the register. We were looking around waiting for it for a while, but now that I know it's not a big deal. 

- Mark on the menu what is/isn't Gluten Free

 Suggestions for Diners: 

- if you're not sure about something, ask! If your food doesn't seem right, cooked enough, etc, don't feel bad, just say something! I wish I had spoken up last night as I think they would have fixed it and I could have added an extra star to my rating. 

- if you're not really into this kind of lifestyle/food choices, don't go and then complain about the pretentious smoothie names or other such nonsense. Honestly, they're supposed to be inspiring and fun. If you want to drink pure sugar for half the price at Jamba Juice, go for it, but know there's a world of difference. 

- If you want to help them make this place even better, SAY SOMETHING, NICELY. I honestly don't believe places like this open without a genuine desire to serve the growing plant based community and promote more ethically inspired cuisine. Help them help us. 

Good, high quality plant based food requires love, skill and high quality ingredients. If you want to PAY someone else to make it for you, that gets baked into the final price. PLUS...you ARE in Las Vegas. Everything costs more here. I'm just grateful for a nice place to get some good food from good people. 

I will give this place another shot for sure and am really looking forward to it.

Best vegan place in town !!! Amazing service and management especially from the little adorable blonde manager she's very attentive and willing to help when choosing options. The food is clean and  tastes spectacular. There cookies are my favorite vegan cookies. Oh and I forgot to note the various juices that they now have!!!

Finally, an upscale, creative and modern take on plant-based cuisine in Las Vegas!  The food here is absolutely delicious and super healthy!  Try the mouthwatering Sunchoke appetizer (it was so good we ordered three of these!), fabulous grain bowls, and their Veggie burger is the best I've ever tasted (and I've tried countless veggie burgers!). And the Blueberry "Cheese"cake is divine!  Not too sweet and to live for. :) Their "mocktails" are fabulous, with the Kombucharita and the Kava Colada being my current favorites. 
I look forward to tasting their future creations as well as enjoying future events. The vibe here is hip, vibrant and cool. I recently attended their "Deep House in the tea house" and the place was packed and hopping with a juicy, gorgeous vibe. I'll be coming to this place again and again!
Kombucha on tap!!!! The Amethyst dream is a new restaurant carnivores and vegans can enjoy!

Love love love this place! Best vegan burger I have ever had. The lavender cheesecake was seriously amazing. The service and atmosphere was perfect. I will for sure be coming back. Weather your a vegan or not you will love this place trust me!
The wait was worth it, beautiful restaurant,  great food and a spiritual atmosphere. Got the Sunchokes appetizer and the gratitude smoothie . Already love the place, I will be back.

Amazing atmosphere, killer playlist, delicious food & Nick, Leroy & Kris are "the man!" They were attentive, knew the menu well & very entertaining (much needed for someone who is terrible at ordering). I had one of their grain bowls & watermelon kombucha - SO GOOD! You'll leave full, in a good way! I would highly suggest sitting at the bar with them. I will definitely be going back
This is one of my favorite places to eat. Staff is very friendly and the food is always delicious.  If you're vegan or not this is a must try.
I come to Panacea often, I love their food and superfood smoothies! Shane and all of his employees are friendly and helpful! Great place, great vibes!

There selection is bit limited, prices are too high, and dining areas are a bit too cramped. Service was pretty good but at times it seems like they get overwhelmed. Burger was decent but for the price you pay your looking for a far better appetizing experience.

Way over priced, the employees are super nice and attentive, it really gets me that I'm only leaving two stars, but based on price I just can't justify another star. A cookie and and a small late... $10.85! And they have no freaking entry way mat, I almost slipped as I walked in. You'd think they can afford a logo mat w those prices.
