Went a week ago for soft opening. It's hands down best vegan restaurant I've ever been to. Very good quality food. Environment is sharp but casual. I suggest adding whole juices. Loved kombucha on tap.

Saw a sponsored post on fb the other day, looked them up on yelp today because we wanted something fresh, yelp said open until 9:30 pm, we drove out 15 minutes, arrived at 9 to be greeted by a sign on the door saying closing early for Father's Day, there wr still people inside and the door was open but we wr turned away, just bummed we drove out coz it said open and wr turned away :(

Been wanting to try this place for a while now as I've heard many greats things! It did NOT disappoint!! 

First off love the decor of in and outside of the space. Cool and chic. 

Ordered the brown rice bowl. It was packed full of flavor. I added the the burger patty (which is plant based) which was deliiiiiish! The cashew cilantro cream is out of control! I could literally eat it on its own with a spoon  Love the presentation as it comes in what looks like a massive half coconut bowl. 

Only reason I didn't give it 5 is that I do think it's a bit pricey. My bowl with added patty was over $20. I didn't even get a drink. 

All in all definitely worth a visit!!
Wonderful plant based Restaurant in Summerlin...Delicious! We tried the Kale Salad, The Forbidden Black Rice bowl, The Ultimate Burger and the Ginger kombucha. Yummy!

Came here on a hot summery Friday morning with a friend since we were intrigued by the idea of venturing towards a new healthy cafe in the downtown Summerlin area. By no means is Panacea purely vegan, however they do carry a lot of plant-based items on their menu.

Sadly they didn't have any samples that day to try, so I decided to splurge a little on the dessert side of their inventory since I don't come by this side of town often.

I opted for their Divine Feminine smoothie since it had the highest intake of antioxidants out of all their smoothies. Originally I wanted to get their Gratitude smoothie since I prefer citrusy flavors, but that'll be an order for another day. This one drink in particular had an inconspicuous taste of berry overload, which is great as I wouldn't have it any other way. An easy sip to finish and I had enough to savor it even upon leaving the building.

Their Chef's Special for dessert was Panacea's version of a raspberry cheesecake with a poppy petal decor on top. A simplistic aesthetic on the eyes. The verdict it being rather tart in taste, it lacked the soft and mushy feeling of a cheesecake though, and if you didn't douse the cake with the sweet raspberry sauce it would seem rather dry in texture. 

Lastly, I took it upon myself to order at least one flavor of their plant-based truffles: goji berry, pistachio, matcha, and some other flavor that I completely forgot. Honestly they all had a taste of granola flavor to them, but the aftertaste wasn't bitter either. I would recommend to have these eaten with greek yogurt to offset the plainness.
They have the BEST salad and kombucha here! The food is presented so beautifully and it's so good too! Best healthy food I have had in a long time  the workers are great and so is the vibe!

Wow! Get out of town!! This place is TOO good. This was my first time eating here and it was absolutely delicious. THE best vegan burger I've ever had. I absolutely loved the sweet potato fries as well. I started the meal off with a "divine feminine" smoothie which was out of this world. I love the architecture, vibe, atmosphere, tables, conversation, and the warm staff. They went way above and beyond in making sure we were accommodated. I have a cashew and pecan allergy and they were ultra careful in making sure I was taken care of. I feel great and am so satisfied by how nourished I am at this moment! YUM! Highly recommend!

I tried this place tonight with my boyfriend as I'm new in town and scoping out new vegan options. I wanted to love this place because the inside is really fun and chic but based on my first meal, I'm not particularly impressed. The menu was nothing special at all, I've had all those dishes other places before. We got the ultimate burger which had two patties on it. My first bite was just very plain and tasted like mostly black beans. The patties were very mushy and I'm not sure why they added two. The side salad that came with it had barely any dressing on it and again, hardly any flavor. We also had a side dish of buffalo cauliflower. The sauce on it was just regular buffalo sauce but the cauliflower was a little limp and nothing special. I did like the ranch dipping sauce. We also had a slice carrot cake for dessert which I enjoyed the most, but again, nothing really special. The staff was nice and the place was super cute but menu offering just so-so. My favorite vegan place so far is Violette's Vegan. My boyfriend is not vegan and he also preferred the burger and appetizers we've had there vs. Panacea.

I don't always eat Vegan; but when I do - I eat at Panacea. 

Our constant fear when ordering Vegan is that we will still feel hungry. That is never a problem when eating here. We are stuffed! 

We ordered the Green Goddess salad, the nachos, sweet potato fries, and the eagle condor smoothie. We loved everything. The salad dressing is not too tart, not too sweet or overpowering - just the right blend for the delicate arugula. The nachos are huge and loaded with vegan cheese, chili, spring onion, tomatoes, and more. We threw some salad on each chip for fun. The sweet potato fries were crispy with several dipping sauces to choose from. Finally, the eagle condor smoothie is pretty good too with cacao and coffee. I'm so full though. We're just gonna take this smoothie home and blend it up with some ice later. 

The decor is inviting and entertaining. The service fantastic. Two sweet and engaging girls behind the counter. We happened to strike up a conversation with the chef too. I just love when people are passionate about what they do and why they do it. 

If I had something to complain about, it might be the music. I'm not sure what you might call it? Techno? House? It's verrry upbeat with an energetic tempo. I just feel like winding down and relaxing during a meal and that wild tempo doesn't seem like the right mood music? Slightly annoyed but not a deal breaker. 

We're definitely coming back and I would recommend Panacea to everyone; Vegan and non Vegan alike. Totally worth the visit!

I hope to see more plant based kitchens in Las Vegas, this place opened in April at Boca Park! We ordered: spicy bourbon brussel sprouts, nachos, and the love burger with a side salad. Spicy bourbon brussel sprouts were so delicious, not spicy at all and tastes more like a teriyaki sauce, which isn't a bad thing at all. The love burger was tasty. However, maybe it was the patty that was a bit moist, so the bottom bun fell apart from becoming soggy. My boyfriend loved it, and he is a fan on all things burgers.
The nachos were big and beautiful, lots of nacho fixings including vegan cheese. It was very filling we had to take it home.
We brought home a snickerdoodle cookie, a goji berry/hemp truffle, a lemon/pistachio truffle, and a CBD water. The sweets were all delicious especially the lemon/pistachio, it was like biting into a lemon pound cake! 

If there's any downside I could bring to mind, it would be the menus. The large menus above the counter has small font lettering. They have personal menus, but the lettering is small also.  I'm a fan of panacea and I'm spreading the word to my friends!
Acai Bowels are amazing! The staff is so friendly and the concept of the restaurant is something so different in Las Vegas than anything I've ever seen before! Love this place!

My husband had the ultimate burger and I had the ultimate burrito. Both were seriously delicious!! I thought the portions were fair. I have seen a few reviews complaining about the price to food ratio (although coming from LA I may have a jaded perspective!!) We were definitely satisfied and I took half of my burrito home. There is a charming coffee bar counter and plenty of seating inside. All the girls that were working were super friendly and cheerful. It seems like this place has a lot of regulars and it's a total locals spot. Very clean and contemporary side. I can't wait to go back!

Why did I wait so long to try this place!! I went this evening with some girlfriends and it was soooo delicious!!! I had the love burger with sweet potato fries served with ranch and ketchup and my friend had the chili wrap with a salad and a green lemonade smoothie. We both cleared our plates. Definitely coming back to try more things on the menu!!

Awesome vegan restaurant. Everything is organic. The portions are a great size. The produce is fresh. They have smoothies as well and vegan desserts. The buffalo cauliflour is absolutely amazing! They have kombucha on tap also :)

Came in to try there latte seeing as how I'm a coffee addict and I need to try all the new coffee spots in town. They don't have any flavorings or regular sugar and they use almond milk for every drink but you don't need all that regular stuff because the espresso is so smooth. It really was a good latte. I will be back soon.

Panacea is always delicious.  They have bomb burgers, delicious apps like buffalo cauliflower and brussell sprouts, and the most amazing tacos on Tuesday.  I wish the tacos were officially on the menu, because honestly I would come more often if they were offered everyday.  The nachos plate is unbelievably huge.  We'll be coming back again and again.

If you are Vegan, go somewhere else. I've been trying to fall in love with this place for months, the idea of it, is fantastic. I love it, high end vegan food. and for the most part the food is delicious. but the high turn over rate of staff that aren't Vegan, and the owner isn't vegan. It's slowly pushing me away. The inconsistency of food, makes it not a good experience. I never know what I am going to get.. I also feel sick after every visit, leading me to believe they might have products that aren't Vegan. The staff don't even know whats in it. YUCK. overpriced, go somewhere else.

My first experience was amazing. Food was great and delicious, especially the Osaka burger but the last few times I've been there the food wasn't consistent and not totally hot. 

Hope they can get their consistency back because I won't go back until then. Too bad because I was willing to pay the high prices for the healthy food.

I am glad we have another plant based option in the valley, especially in Summerlin. Their burgers are probably one of the best plant based burgers I have had. I would definitely recommend that you give it a go.

Best place to eat in Vegas healthy and vegan, very creative and wonderful flavors. 
As someone that loves healthy food I've lived in Vegas for 5 years and couldn't find a place especially close by to eat! But after eating here last night I just wanted to come back for more. 
The owner Shane and the employees are very nice and welcoming. Very cool vibe! And they have cool tinctures to add to drinks/shots and Kambucha on tap (no alcohol)
I never write reviews but I had to...

Amazing new vegan restaurant in Boca Park. The food was unbelievably good, the service and employees were awesome. I will definitely be back. Highly recommend Panacea to all vegans and non-vegans alike. Mmmmmm!!
Food and drinks are great, the customer service is weak. Blonde lady was kind of rude. Felt like she threw my food at me and was saying something about utensils as she was walking Away.

This is probably one of the best plant based restaurants I have EVER been to. Everything from the food to the costumer service was amazing. I had the buffalo cauliflower as an appetizer and I was very impressed!! I also ordered their "love" burger and i have to say I thought it was better than any other burger I've tried. I definitely recommend everyone to try this place out!

In love with this place!! Found my new favorite spot in Las Vegas! Service was quick and staff are super friendly. Food is incredibly fresh and health conscious - animal conscious too! It's vegetarian, however has the most epic burgers! Atmosphere, lighting and decor make for an amazing environment.

I have been patiently awaiting the opening of this place for almost a year now. I had already been speaking so highly of it to my boyfriend because I just KNEW it was gonna be good. He's not a vegan by any means, but I always try to get him to eat plant based whenever I can. I have successfully managed to make 2 other vegan restaurants a part of his top 5 restaurants in Vegas, and I had planned for this place to be a third. So yesterday, I convinced him to come try Panacea with me. 

4:10pm (I know because the time is printed on the receipt) - The cashier rings in my order. My boyfriend didn't even order a drink and the bill was $50. He looked at me like "really?" So far I was not doing a good job of convincing him that this place was going to be great haha. 

4:25pm - I go up to the lady that's behind the counter and ask her for water cups while we wait. She says she will bring them to my table and hands me the smoothie I ordered. 

4:40pm - My boyfriend starts getting impatient and says "You just paid $50 to wait over half an hour to get any food." I guess so. We hadn't even received our appetizer or the water that the lady said she was going to bring to the table. Meanwhile, the guy checking up on all the tables is asking everyone else how their doing, but seems to be avoiding us. My boyfriend walked up to the lady that had been making food behind the counter and asks about our order, she replies, "We are getting there."

4:45pm - The same lady behind the counter walks up to our table to ask us what we ordered....wait, what?!??? This meal was definitely not going as I had planned. Thank goodness we weren't on a time crunch.  

4:55pm - Yay! Our appetizer has arrived! Not long after, the rest of our meal arrives as well. I was still super annoyed, but this nice blonde lady came out and explained exactly what happened. She said they still haven't figured out the receipt system so the orders tend to get mixed up out of sequence. This was all we needed as customers. From the guy avoiding us to the girl claiming she was working on our order, we just wanted an honest explanation. 

Now the food...was delicious! We got the rutabaga & sun choke bravas for an appetizer. I liked it, but my boyfriend didn't. I got the kale-green bowl for my entree and he got the cracked freekeh. Both were good, but the Cracked Freekeh bowl was AMAZING! My boyfriend even had to admit that it was extremely tasty. 

To sum it up...

Decor: Simply beautiful. There's no denying that. From the art on the walls to the plants on the tables, everything matches well with the name and theme. 

Price: Expensive. The food is overpriced, but that's become the norm these days for health conscious eateries. I hate when I try to tell people plant based is the way to go and they reply that it's "too expensive." It really shouldn't be, but yeah, at this restaurant it is. 

Service: Obviously we didn't receive the best service on our visit, but it's a brand spanking new restaurant that's still working out some kinks. I'm hopeful that this will improve as time goes on. 

Food: Delicious! The food was fresh and there was much attention paid to detail. The grain bowl we tried was full of an array of flavors. I will for sure be back to try more of their menu items. The food and the girl that explained the situation to us are the reasons for the 4 stars.

This was great !!
The food is awesome !!
The service was wonderful 
I had the ultimate burrito and my non 
Vegan friend who didn't want anything 
Ate half and the fries ..
The ranch and the paprika Aiello sauce was the 
BEST I'VE EVER  HAD 
OH and my non Vegan friend ate my whole 
Cookie while I waited for my food ..
So needless to say , we will be back
Omg! I love the food!!! Drinks are so healthy and taste very dress defiantly coming back

WOW. I've been here about 10 times so far and will not hesitate to return. This place is GREAT. The BEST vegan burger (Love burger) I've had in Las Vegas, it stays together well and the flavor is outstanding. The employees have always been so nice to me and I would recommend this to anyone.

This was seriously the best plant based canteen I've ever been to! The ultimate burger was so delicious and cooked to perfection. I had a sample of this delicious green smoothie so I can't wait to come back and try them all! I got to meet the owner Shane and he was a delight. The prices are reasonable, and all of the food sounds delicious! I believe they're still in their soft opening so i can't wait to try the rest of their food!

Cute interior and amazing roomy upstairs

This is honestly the cutest establishment in Boca park and I am so happy I finally got to check this place out!

Absolutely amazing food. It was so exciting to have the entire menu be VEGAN and so beyond any place I have ever tried! I had the BBQ burger, all the flavors came together magically, The texture of the Patty was perfect. My son even wanted his own burger,  after his kids meal. My son is not vegan yet so it's amazing that he liked the taste. The salad came with a very light oil free dressing,  had a bit of a lemon taste. I am so glad I found this place and wish I knew about it before.  The staff was also Amazing, caring and professional. One of the owners even gave me a number of a resource for my son.  I will be coming back here for sure, also they have a Turmeric Vanilla Latte that is to die for!
If they only made The Ultimate Burger and Nothing else, I would still be In Love...BEST PLANT BASED BURGER IN TOWN! Everything else is AMAZING as well! #plantbasedwhat ?!

Meh. For the price, I am NOT impressed. My co-workers and I just ordered lunch for pick-up. Two of us got the Love Burger, and one got the Ultimate Burger. With the Ultimate Burger being $17, she had some expectations... and was so unimpressed. 

I personally got the Love Burger - I ordered it without a pickle or the pink onions and with cheese. What I ended up with? A burger with lettuce. No cheese... since somehow they forgot. The patty had no flavor and was not worth the $14 (which included soggy shoe-string fries). 

My co-worker that ordered the Love Burger, did not love it at all. She said it lacked flavor with the exception of the pickle and mustard.

Would I go back? I don't think so - I would rather lose my money in a slot machine trying to win Megabucks than pay for an over-priced mediocre meal from Panacea. Which is a bit sad since I was so excited for a vegan/plant-based restaurant.

The food and drink offerings at Panacea are varied and delicious.

The servings are quite large. I usually leave stuffed. The smoothies are all PRO! Lately I've been trying their Gratitude smoothie or the X-cycle smoothie. The Gratitude has some of my favorite flavors (lemonade-mixed-with-ginger). There's lots of kinds of juices, kombucha, teas, espresso, beer(?), and more.

There's always something new to eat. My recent favorite is the spinach fettuccini. It's a bowl of green noodles with a mix of veggies. It all compliments each other very well. The broth is savory but not too heavy. I like to ask for extra veggies which provides a perfect balance.

Seriously there's always new things to eat and drink. Panacea keeps it alive by always having something different, whether it's food, drinks, or entertainment.

The staff is incredibly friendly. It's always a pleasant experience to go there to eat and chat with friendly faces. I visit Panacea often due to the combination of deliciousness + variety of food + variety of drinks + friendly staff.
The drink is called MACA MATCHA I added CACAO. Truly amazing spot. Great vibe. Good energy. VeggieVeggieVeggie if U wanna.
Food is great but the service is awkward. Been 3 times now and every time I stand around for the employees to finish their conversation then get greeted by an annoyed cashier. So weird.
Superb quality. Urban-style venue. Friendly staff. The best if not second best vegan eatery in Vegas. Life is better when it's plant-based!

Ehhhhhhhh.

The Yelp Book Club met here this past Saturday, and I have to say...I probably won't come back.  

Tucked away in a shopping center, Panacea is a "plant based" (not Vegan) cafe that is beautiful to walk into, but that's about where the good stopped for my visit.

First and foremost:  Their menus are on two separate walls. Above the register is all the food and sweets.  Next to the register, completely out of view, was the smoothie menu.  I had no idea where people were getting the smoothies they were walking out with.    

Second:  For a place that's been open for 2 months, I'd expect the full menu to be available.  Yet they still have "coming soon" next to several of their items.  Super disappointing, considering I'm a hummus freak, and would have loved to try their hummus plate.  

Third:  This place is really spendy for not a lot of food.    The burger is small.  The sweets are small.  The smoothies are 24 oz, but...they're $9 a piece.   

As for quality:  meh.  The smoothie we ordered, the "Gratitude"  (kind of pretentious smoothie names, in my opinion): Green Grapes, Kale, Spinach, Dandelion, Ginger, Lemon, Green Cabbage, Orange, Apple, was ok.  But Jamba Juice is better, and cheaper.  
The cupcake was ok.  It was comically placed in a GIGANTIC bowl...one tiny cupcake in an enormous bowl...and honestly, I've had better at other Vegan joints.  
The edamame was good.  I did enjoy that.  I thought the cilantro was a nice touch.

Service was severely lacking too.  Pretentious attitude when I asked a question, and that's never ok.  

Definitely disappointed in this place.  I really wanted to like it a lot, but it was just lacking too much for me to give any more than 2 stars.   Would not recommend.  Most likely will not be back.

If you're new to vegan food, then Panacea may not be the best place to experience it. I'm not saying that the food is not good, but the flavors are very earthy. 

I ordered the fettuccine alfredo, the Love burger, a BBQ burger, chili cheese fries, chocolate chip cookie, and a mock Hostess cupcake. 

The burgers were decent, but not worth the price. The Love Burger was topped with sautéed onions, dill pickles, lettuce, ginger mustard, and chipotle ketchup, plus a side salad.In spite of them burning the bun of my BBQ burger, the toppings were still really yummy. I especially enjoyed the contrasting flavors of the dill pickles and the sweet BBQ sauce. The onion straws on the burger were delicious too. 

I substituted one side salad for chili cheese fries, which were on the bland side. I even wondered if they actually added cheese to the fries. Note to self, stick to the regular fries next time. 

My least favorite entree was the Umami spinach fettuccine. It was way too busy and extremely spicy. 
I'm all about getting my daily dose of vegetables, but the dish looked more like a science experiment. Maybe the packing (on to-go orders) could be done differently.

On a positive note, I was given a sample of a very tasty green smoothie that's worth coming back for! 

Lastly, my chocolate chip cookie was phenomenal, but the Hostess cupcake needs more cream in the middle and more chocolate icing. Otherwise, it's very moist and chocolatey. 

I'm on the fence with this place, but will more than likely give them another shot. It's a really cute place and the servers are friendly.

First time visiting. Loved the vibes of this spot! Upstairs is great for lounging with a book. We ordered the Inner Peace (they kindly split it into two glasses for us to share) and devoured it. Later, we had the Ultimate Burger, and were once again blown away (can't wait to have my newly plant-based parents try it out)! 100% would recommend, will return, and would re-order these items.

I will return because this is a vegan spot with a cool vibe. The food is amazing and I have yet to find something I don't like. It is a bit on the pricey side especially if you want fries with your $10-$13 burger. Cheese is extra for the burger.

Easily the best vegan food in the valley. I'm the only vegan in my family and going out to dinner can be a pain sometimes but my husband and children love this place too. The love burger is my kids favorite and my husband loves the ultimate burger and buffalo cauliflower is my personal favorite. Their hops kombucha is the best kombucha I've tried anywhere.

This place!! Is INCREDIBLE my hubby & I ordered the gratitude smoothie, hummus Bowl, Ultimate Nachos, the Osaka Burger & cheese cake. It was all very delicious! Definitely recommend it everything plant base! Beautiful decor, clean and friendly staff!

This place is a rip off and the service really sucks. I was disappointed in my $22 salad. The food took forever to come lol not sure why a salad would take more that 45 minutes to make and the service was horrible. Never coming back again. Save your money for a place that taste good and has great service.

I'll start by saying this place is outstanding and one of the only places to get good clean quality food with quality ingredients. One of my favorite things to start with is the Sunchoke brava  appetizer with paprika aioli. They are absolutely delicious. One of my favorite entrées to order is the Ultimate Burrito. It has brown rice, jalapeño tomato water, herb oil, Pinto beans, soy chorizo, vegan shredded cheddar cheese, pico de gallo, pickled red and napa cabbage, cherry tomatoes, toasted pumpkin seeds, avocado, cilantro, green onions, guajillo sauce and cilantro cashew cream. It's amazing. Another favorite is this Asian Osaka burger. This is a Togarashi seasoned burger patty, toasted bun, smoked paprika aoili, sautéed mushrooms, yakitori-sweet chili sauce, pickled red cabbage, green onions, avocado and furikakae...! You simply have to try this burger to understand how good it is. They have an upstairs dining area tables downstairs and an outside patio. They also have a small food bar to eat at which is nice if you just want to run in and grab a quick bite. They have Wi-Fi which is always good for those that need it. I could go on anon about how good this places but the review would end up being too long lol. This place is a must try

First time trying panacea and I got the grain bowl and I'm not vegan but this bowl was so flavorful and delicious and i would highly recommend this cute new place in boca park!! So delicious... the employees were so nice too!

Trying to eat "clean" or at least cleaner while on the road can be difficult. We were in Vegas visiting a brother and I brought enough veggies and juicing from my home but we ended up staying longer than anticipated. I was so hungry, we yelped one similar place that was permanently closed and we were driving toward the freeway in disappointment when we passed by this establishment. Holy cow! It's small, very clean, and staff inviting. The cashier explained everything to us that we had questions about. The food vegan, was so fresh, presentation gorgeous and flavor....I'm still savoring our lunch! The chef came out to see if everybody was doing well and he was cheerful. Great pride was taken in how these plates were put together. A must try!

AMAZING!!! My favorite things here are the edemame,  the LOVE Burger and the non-dairy dark chocolate milk shake. My sweetheart loves the sweet potato fries, too. We have tried a number of their dishes but I must say - the veggie burgers are DIVINE. We couldn't even tell this was a veggie patty  

Nice atmosphere, convinient location and healthy yet delicious food options - you can't go wrong with Panacea.

I've eaten at Panacea several times since they opened. I've tried burgers, grain bowls, salads, burritos, cookies and Kombuchas. I'm very pleased with the dog friendly patio out front and I'm pleased that it is one of many plant based dining options in the valley now. 
 
   I have pros and cons. Panacea has been very hit or miss for me. Last Friday was my most recent visit. I had the Spicy bourbon brussel sprouts as an appetizer which I have had several times. Sometimes I get them and they are superbly perfect and dripping in the spicy bourbon sauce. Other times like last Friday they were dry as a bone and just blackened in appearance with just a hint of spicy bourbon sauce flavors. Perhaps some of the chefs have more skills or experience. 
 For my entree I had the Ultimate burrito. One of the main ingredients is Soyrizo. I feel the Soyrizo really ties the whole burrito together with explosive flavor but for whatever reason my burrito this time around had maybe a teaspoon of Soyrizo. I'm guessing either they were short on Soyrizo, being cheap or poor burrito building skills by the chef of that evening. My burrito was also extremely dry too. I think for the cost they should also come with sides of fresh salsa or some hot sauce options to customize them to your individual liking. Keep in mind that I've also had the burrito when it's ingredients were well balanced, juicy and flawless with flavors. When I have something delicious I love to return and have it several more times and it is such a let down that I never know if it's gonna be a delicious night or a flop. I may bring my own salsa in the future if they don't start to offer it. 

  Next the kombucha on tap is a favorite of mine. I had grape last time and it was perfect. I've found that everywhere I have kombucha on tap it's hit or miss in the flavor and carbonation departments. So I can't blame Panacea when One is a dud. So thumbs up to the kombuchas. 
  The cookies I have tried were all rich, sweet and delicious. Sometimes a little on the high dollar side for the quantity but I imagine rent is through the sky in this location so that's, well that. 

  Last but not least the employees. Fortunately I've had more extremely friendly and helpful experiences than the polar opposite. Everyone has a bad day so I don't take bad service personally unless it's a constant thing with the same people. 
  I won't give up on Panacea because I've had more good meals than bad ones. I will keep you updated on future visits to Panacea.

Panacea is great vibrant atmosphere. From the moment you walk in, it creates a calm vibe where you can feel open to try whatever is on the menu. Their menu is mainly vegetarian/vegan friendly, but they do not broadcast their items specifically. It makes a carnivore eater try new things that taste similar, but yet is way more healthy and better for you. 

Kale salad hands down the most amazing and beautiful salad you'll ever try! So many flavors you taste in one bite. They "Kaled it!" 

As for the Asian Osaka burger, it is one of the best vegan burgers I've ever had. The flavors of the "meat" taste so meat like, you can't believe it's not meat. 

Cheese burger, hummus bowl, edamame bowl & Green goddess arugula salads are all amazing. They are all portioned well to the amount to pay. 

Definitely a great place to catch up with girlfriends, or have a big party upstairs that you can ask to reserve from the owner who is also an amazing host to his great business.

So I am always for supporting small, health-centric businesses especially considering this one has lots of vegan options. I don't mind paying $18 for a burrito and a tip every once in a while. But not when it comes it completely cold and 20 minutes later. It was completely cold - so cold that I'm not sure if it was actually supposed to be served that way.

Updating my review because I gave it another shot. Had the Freekeh bowl.... once again came out literally 35 minutes later and it was apparently this super fly, bomb signature bowl that everyone raved about. Ahhhh it was so bad. Literally like raw chickpeas, and this weird beet tahini/hummus, and like cold soggy peppers and weirdness. Oh it was so bad. On the plus side though, had their Pachamama and that smoothie was really good. I wouldn't call it a "caffeinated" smoothie though or anything. Keep in mind, those two came to almost $30.

Well like apparently their ingredients are not organic so until there's some clarification that they serve only organic ingredients I won't be returning.
 I'm not a fan of "healthy" places that serve alcohol anyway.

Awful service. Went in this evening, 3 girls behind counter..  Placed our order and before completing our payment on the screen your asked for a tip.... before they even service you?....I uncomfortably pick a percentage to tip....(If i choose no tip, will they not make our drinks satisfactory??..
we then sit down....  The girl that took our order at the register disappears to the back...we are sitting there wondering who's making our drinks?  There are 2 girls left behind the counter ...one is wiping her nose on her arm while slicing oranges telling the other girl how sick she is...the other girl then responds with "Yeah me too"....all this time passes and were still wondering where are drinks are?  Is the girl that disappeared to the back making them back there? because these 2 girls are certainly clueless.. 
Girl in back reappears  acts shocked we havent been served yet. Starts making our drinks...at this point I wanted to forget the whole thing..as were watching we see her take a rotten banana entirely black, peel it and put in the machine. We asked her about the black banana and all she said was "that's not your drink that's for another customer"...well okay....I think........Drinks werent measured right and worst service. We will not go back there. Unsanitary teenagers making overpriced fruit drinks...Did I tip ahead of time for this service??.....
This place is great if your feeling like a fresh healthy meal.  I always leave feeling like I lost 10 lbs but belly is stuffed somehow.
New healthy spot. Food was good but needs better menu boards to understand what you are ordering otherwise you will lean on the staff.  Well prepared takeout if you wanted to go that route.

Burger patties made out of QUINOA?! Say no more!! 

Panacea has easily become one of my absolute favorite restaurants since becoming vegan. Their umami spinach fettuccine won my heart at first bite and I have found myself craving it on a weekly basis. If it weren't for how pricey the food was, I would probably be here on a daily basis honestly! I understand that plant-based food ain't cheap but I do find myself only eating here when I have extra money in my pocket haha. 

Their menu is packed with delicious sounding foods and so far I've tried the ultimate burger, cracked freekeh bowl, forbidden black rice bowl, the Osaka burger and I can honestly say they have the BEST vegan burgers in town!!! Super flavorful, juicy, and guilt free, yassss! The burgers come with a side of salad or fries for $2.50 more and a slice of cheese for $1 extra.

They also serve an array of desserts - their cookies are massive and addicting (applesauce is the egg substitute ingredient that makes them so yummy!); the snickerdoodle is a must try! They also serve smoothies, coffees/lattes, and kombucha on tap! 

The ambiance is also what keeps me coming back, especially the upstairs! It has a modern and hip vibe with dim lighting to it that just makes it perfect for studying, meeting with a friend for lunch or going on a nice date. 

Panacea is definitely on my top favorite plant-based restaurants in Vegas and the prices are the only thing holding me back from giving 5 stars!

Wow!!! What an amazing Vegan restaurant !!! Great food and great service!
Will def be back!! Loved it!
We ordered the Buffalo cauliflower,  the nachos and one of the Burgers. Everything was so good!!

This place is perfect for feel-good food. Tasty, flavorful, vegan, with a great space to dine in. I've had the burgers, the grain bowls, and a burrito, and loved them all. Shockingly good french fries!

Wow !! As a long time Vegan & connoisseur of Veggie Burgers .. I just had the best ever here at Panacea !! Which I believe was just voted Best Veggie Burger by VegansBaby.com as well .. so I'm not alone in thinking so ... the smoothies were amazing as expected as the owner started Grassroots ... the desserts were scrumptious also 

This place is beautiful & we will definitely be back .. so many more delicious things we need to try !!

I joined Loren for dinner here tonight as we both had been wanting to try this place. When we walked in, the place was pretty empty. We strained to view the small menu hanging overhead until the lady behind the counter noticed us and provided us with the paper menus.

The restaurant itself is not huge, but clean and colorful. They feature some cool art and a choice to dine upstairs or downstairs. Upstairs is more private and has some unique lighting using the Einstein bulbs that I love. 

The menu features many unique vegan style options and so I just went with what sounded good to me. I decided on the "Love Burger" and the "Gratitude" smoothie. The burger was all plant based with black beans, quinoa etc. along with shredded lettuce, agrodulce onions, cabbage, pickles, mustard and ketchup. I also had a side of fries with sea salt. The smoothie was made of green grapes, kale, spinach, dandelion, ginger, lemon and apple. The burger was fresh and tasty and I really couldn't taste the difference between a regular meat burger and this burger. The burger was definitely small for the price. My smoothie was also very good and it was a healthy serving so I know I definitely had my required "greens" for the day. My total check was $23.25 which I was like (cough, cough) what???? That was damn expensive for a burger, fries and a smoothie but I did feel really good when I was done. No heavy feeling of fullness like when I eat a regular meat burger and I did have some extra energy too so I ran home (just kidding). I did have a chance to taste Loren's Buffalo Cauliflower which in my opinion was the star of the meal. The buffalo sauce was nice and spicy and gave this normally boring veggie a kick. The only issue is they could have spared a little more dipping sauce. 

Overall the experience was fun and I may come back again just to enjoy more of the cauliflower and another smoothie.

My friend and I came here for brunch and were extremely satisfied with everything. The service was amazing and the lady at the register was super friendly and answered all of our questions (it was our first time here). My friend got the chili, which she said was the best chili she's ever had in her life, even compared to the chili's she's had before she went vegan. I got the Divine Feminine smoothie and I honestly think it was the most amazing thing i've ever tasted in my life. The rose flavor was very strong, but not strong enough to make it taste bad. Definitely worth the 9 ish dollars it costed.

Located near Cheesecake Factory in Boca Park, I visit here specifically for the smoothies and atmosphere.

When you walk in, you can immediately pick up on the relaxing, organ vibe. Don't forget to visit the cool seating area upstairs.

The employees there are always friendly and knowledgeable.

Although I've had their amazing burger before in the past, I choose my favorite smoothie with double greens. To say that it's delicious is an understatement.

Along with free WiFi, this is a great place to eat healthy in a wonderful environment.

Vegetarian meals in Boca Park.  Gr8 meatless burgers, salads, smoothies and desserts.  Pricey but nice ambiance and service.  Menu is limited but fresh and healthy ingredients.    Once bugs are worked out the earthy feel is a welcome relief to the surrounding chain restaurants.  Loved the brewed kombucha.

Look up 'slow' in the dictionary. You'll find a definition of the word slow, which describes their service. Over 30 minutes for a pasta dish ordered at a counter? When the restaurant isn't even that full? 

Now, if the pasta dish I ordered had blown me away, I would still be positive. But it just wasn't very good. It was more like a soup than a pasta, and not a particularly good soup, with a bland broth that attenuated the flavor of the veggies into a vaguely spinachy flavor. Not very good at all.

So, slow service + disappointing food = 2 stars.

The Asian Vegan Burger is simply Outstanding ... I have been ranting and raving about it for the past couple of days since I had it to anyone who will listen. The atmosphere is pleasant and service was definitely on point. Going back very soon to try something else on the menu but it is going to be very difficult to not grab the Burger again... I don't remember the name of the green smoothie I had but it was delicious and from my understanding they have a Kombucha Bar that needs my attention next time I visit!!! 5***** in my book

You can always tell when the wait staff, cooks, and owners take pride in what they do, and it is quite apparent when you're here that there is a lot of pride in this little restaurant. 

Panacea quite literally means to heal. So they are cleverly hiding their mission statement in plain sight! To heal the body with healthy food and drink is the oldest medicine in recorded history. 

The only reason for the missing 5th star is because most people I talk to that have eaten here for lunch say they end up spending almost double than they normally do on lunch. And people that I talk to that have eaten here for dinner say they wish they offered a few beer and wine options. 

As Americans, the bar has been set very low for the quality of food that we choose to consume. It is going to take several more restaurants like this one to help retrain the American pallet to recognize that flavorful can also be healthy. Keep up the good work Panacea! (The Love burger is my favorite.)

I'm updating my review because unfortunately panacea is a bit inconsistent, when I first came here I was blown away, the plant based burger was delicious, it's hard to find a good vegan burger and the Divine feminine smoothie was phenomenal but ever since I've been back at least 3+ times it's not nearly as good the burger is okay not amazing and the smoothie always tastes different like the ratios are off and its just not nearly as good as it had been and the customer service is also inconsistent sometimes the people working there are really nice and friendly and a couple other times they aren't nice and have an attitude and this place is really expensive we like to get a good amount and end up spending about 70+ dollars which is pretty expensive but it is all plant based so i feel like i have to eat more to feel full but definitely overpriced for what it is and not even sure if they use all organic ingredients etc.. but I'm still pretty satisfied when I leave this place just not sure the price justifies overall what panacea has to offer it's not somewhere I go frequently and only worth going if I'm in the area already and in the mood for a plant based meal.

Just tried this place for takeout for lunch one day and it's BOMB. I got the Ultimate Burger and the Forbidden Rice bowl. The Ultimate Burger was good although I'm a little over veggie burgers. But the Forbidden Rice bowl is where it's at! Too good. Can't wait to actually dine in here.

Overrated. I was SUPER excited to eat at this place after following them on IG and seeing all the beautiful dishes they serve. I eat vegan and vegetarian a few times a week and was pretty bummed at the lack of flavor in the dishes. Staff/Environment:  I got there, the staff wasn't very inviting, and didn't explain how to order. Wasn't sure who worked there or if friends were behind the counter? Very lovely inside, decor was nice. Food: I ordered the Forbidden Black Rice after learning the "Buddha Bowl" I saw on IG was just post made by the owner that the waitress said "he must have just posted because he liked the picture". There were lots of fresh ingredients in the bowl and it was gorgeous, however, there was no flavor! It needed a dressing or something to tie it all together- it was basically plain veggies on top of a bed of black rice. I didn't finish it and felt bad as it was $15. My friends ordered the Love Burger and the Ultimate Burger, both were not impressed and didn't finish their dishes either. They liked the buffalo cauliflower and said the dip was tasty. Wont be back.

Panacea, defined by the dictionary as a remedy for all disease or ills; an answer or solution for all problems or difficulties.

Very cool name for a dining establishment, touting a healthy and healthful menu of smoothies, salads that is also vegan friendly.

It is located in Boca Park, next to The Cheesecake Factory.  So parking that is super close will be rough to find, but that is nothing healthy minded individuals that decided to park in their parking structure a few extra steps away can't handle.

The restaurant looks very modern, with additional seating spaces upstairs. The view upstairs is great, the use of mirrors and the angle of view makes it totally looks far more spacious than it actually is, as the illusion of seeing the bar seating area (directly below you) downstairs plays a cool trick on you.

On my visit, it happens to be their soft opening (first day in fact), which is credited to my friend Leo that told me to check them out because they do Kung fu Tea ceremony and also serves kombucha tea.

After quickly glancing at their menu (I only noticed their drink menu at first) and did not see kombucha tea, so I opted to try one of their smoothies. I asked for a recommendation and since I said I preferred to try something "berries" instead of "green", the Divine Feminine was what I ended up ordering along with 118* Chopped Salad. 

I headed upstairs and after a few minutes, the very beautiful lady with blonde hair wearing a crisp chef coat came upstairs to ask if almond milk is okay or would I want coconut water, I picked almond milk (since that's one of the options for smoothie orders, with Coconut Milk being the other option). 

Then she came back with a beautiful plate of salad. It has a lot of different greens (arugula, mustard greens?) and tomato halves and shaved fennel, carrot, radicchio, and fanned avocado slices. It didn't look like the 18* Chopped Salad that I thought I ordered, but whatever. The lady that took my order must have punched in the order incorrectly or didn't hear me correctly, the music can be loud at times.  But it was delicious. I love the vibrant tomatoes that balanced out the pepperiness of some of the salad greens.

After a long wait, a server finally came upstairs asking if anyone is still waiting for their smoothie order. That's when my Divine Feminine smoothie was served in the familiar plastic cup adorned with a sticker with their restaurant name and graphics.  It was quite good, I finished in a matter of minutes.

I am glad the restaurant opened offering healthier menus, which is something I have to mentally force myself to try. You know bacon, good slow braised shortribs and Chinese honey BBQ pork are hard for omnivore like me to resist. I look forward to checking out their menu once they graduated from their soft opening phase.

* The Green Green was the salad I was served.

I ordered the Godess salad which was pretty good. I would have given 5 stars if the customer service was better. My girlfriend and I stood in line while the guy was talking to other people showing off. When the to go order was done he walked away not even acknowledging us. A young lady saw my disgust and quickly helped us out. This would be a great place if the guy would treat all his people who come in like they matter. I own my own business and I do just that.

Came here for brunch because one of my best friends are vegan. This spot is super cute and close to Cheesecake Factory. I love how they have an owl mural and their staff is so friendly. 

I choose the chili bowl and the gratitude smoothie. Initially I wasn't going to get the smoothie but we were able to try some samples and I loved it. The chili bowl was really big and although there wasn't any meat in it. I enjoyed it. My friends chose to get the nachos and my other friend choose a burrito. I really liked how the French fries were like shoe string fries and how the staff gave us extra sauce and were really friendly. 

Overall, the food was shareable and I loved the friendliness of the staff. Next time I'd like to try some of their desserts. I was really stuffed but there were these giant peanut butter cookies calling my name! So the next time that'll be a must to try!
